loans.name: Borin

texts.en:
Mr. Borin H., age 38, and his wife, Mrs. Kimsan Ny (both available in the photo), age 31, live about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1996 and have two daughters. Besides his daughters, they also has his mother and grandmother living with him. 
Borin and his wife have been selling fish for four years. They buy fish from fishermen and transport tH. to sell in the village. Beyond selling fish, the couple also grows lotus. Borin is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase a motorbike to carry fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to carry fish to sell.

loans.name: Mariela Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Mariela  Del Carmen tiene 30 años de edad, esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamiento pues ya ha tenido la experiencia. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio como es la pulpería, Mariela enfrento un gran desafío como es la poca afluencia de clientes en su negocio, pero esto no ha detenido a esta mujer que tiene todas las fuerzas de luchar y sacar adelante a su familia. Ella es madre de 2 hijos que se esfuerza por proporcionarle lo necesarios. El deseo de Mariela es que sus hijos tengan un lugar propio donde vivir. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariela Del Carmen is 30 years old. This is not the first time requesting funding as she has already had the experience. Over the past 5 years Mariela has been dedicated to her grocery store. Although she has faced a major challenge due to the low flow of customers, this has not stopped this strong woman with the fight to move her family forward. She is mother of 2 children who strives to provide for their needs. Mariela's dream is for her children to have a proper place to live. She requests this loan for working capital for purchasing raw materials.


Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en: Altangerel is 55 years old and lives with his wife in Arhangai, Mongolia. They live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a ger. Their children are grown and have left home. Altangerel and his wife operate a dairy production business at a local market. He produces and sells milk, curd and skim milk. He has been in the business since 2007 and has steadily expanded it. During the summer he sells only milk but in the spring and autumn he sells other dairy products as well. Altangerel would like to improve his livestock and develop breeds. He is optimistic about the future and hopes to grow his business into a stable operation. Altangerel is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug (~ 2815 USD) loan to purchase livestock.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for his diary business

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Mrs. Raquel B., 36, lives in Fernan, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. She is married with three school-age children. Her husband is an engineer who has worked as an OFW in Saudi Arabia for the past year earning only a minimum salary. To help her husband support the family, she opened a sari-sari (variety) store. She’s been in this business for six years and has been able to sustain it even in times of crisis. She earns an average net income of P4,000.00 a month. Raquel joined the PDP-LP Program cooperative just this year. As a new member, she is requesting an amount of P7,000.00 to add to her business capital. Future income will be used for basic needs, loan repayments, and savings. Raquel hopes that some day she can build a separate stall for her sari-sari store.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Sany's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sany L., 48, is the village bank president selected by the sixteen members of the group loan, located in Spean Dek village in Kandal province. Each member of this village group will use the loan to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Sany L. is a drink seller who earns a small income to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. She decided to ask for a loan to buy more drinks to enlarge her business; she wants to use the rest of the loan to buy soil to fill in her yard. Her husband, Mr. Kranh Art, is a fisherman who can support his family a little with his small income. This couple has six children: two are laborers, one is a drink seller, one is a student at the local school and two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: to buy more drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying a motorbike

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia T., 51, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Fidel T., they are blessed with seven children. She has been managing her own variety store while also having a direct selling business on the side. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. 

Leticia has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. She is consistent in paying her dues because she has used the money she borrowed in the past to expand and improve her variety store and direct selling business. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. 

To ensure the future success of her business, Leticia has applied for a PHP 9,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying groceries needed to replenish her current product inventory. She will also invest a portion of the loan to do advance orders on her direct selling line.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She also hopes that she will be able to renovate her house with all her hard work on her business.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries to replenish current inventory

loans.name: Phach

texts.en:
Mr. P. is 26 years old and is a resident of Kompong Tom Province, where he has established a small family with other members. P. has a life partner in his wife who appears in the above photo.

To pursue a daily income, P. climbs palm trees to tap juice which he boils into sugar to sell. In addition, he also leaves home to buy chop-wood (firewood) to resell. His wife earns a living by raising rice and pigs in the village. This couple is able to generate $6 a day to cover the financial crisis of their family, and they have a young kid who is dependent on their income.

Mr. P. will be using this loan to add to his saving in order to buy a piece of his neighbor’s farmland. It is in a good location for him and his wife to plant crops.

loans.use: To buy a piece of his neighbor’s farmland

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Madame Aissatou S. habite à  Ouakam. Elle est sociétaire  de la caisse depuis 7 ans et a déjà bénéficié  de 4 prêts  antérieurs. Elle évolue  depuis 4 ans dans le commerce et la vente de tissus et articles divers. Elle a choisi cette activité  dans le but d’éviter l’oisiveté  et aussi d’acquérir  des revenus permanents. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 500 000 frs pour relancer  son activité mais aussi  accroitre son stock de marchandises. Madame S. est une femme mariée  qui a 4 enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Aissatou S. lives in Ouakam.  She has been an associate of the credit association for seven years and has already had four loans.  She has had a business for four years selling cloth and various items.  She chose this business to avoid idleness and also to acquire a steady income.  She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to reinvigorate her business but also to increase her stock of merchandise.  Ms. S. is a married woman who has four children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her working capital

loans.name: Nasarie

texts.en:
Nasarie P. is from the village of Frankfort, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 41 years old. Nasarie is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Nasarie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Nasarie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nasarie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nasarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Nasarie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Nasarie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Neziver

texts.en:
Neziver R. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Neziver owns and operates a farming business, primarily selling copra (the dried meat, or kernel, of the coconut). Neziver has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it. In 2005, Neziver joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Neziver has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. Neziver is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to redeem her pawned land. This will be the 13th loan taken out by Neziver from PMPC.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To redeem pawned land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more merchandise like: blouses, skirts, pants and children's clothes.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe BADENYA sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et  3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles polygames à MAMASSONI, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et tous les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait essentiellement le commerce de produits alimentaires tels, les concombres, la pomme de terre, le poisson fumé et les oranges avec YOUMA K..
YOUMA K., compte acheter avec son  prêt  50 sacs d’orange.
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché du quartier MEDINE de la ville de Sikasso et dans les vergers des villages voisins .
Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Badenya group are all married women, on the average 41 years old, with three children. They live in polygamous families in Mamassoni, a district in the town of Sikasso, in the third administrative district of Mali. This is their 7th experience with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The loan is needed to respond to their customers’ needs; all previous loans have been duly repaid. This group of women is mainly engaged in selling food products, such as cucumbers, potatoes, smoked fish and, as in Youma K.'s case, oranges. Youma K. plans to use her loan to purchase 50 bags of oranges. She buys oranges at the big market of the Medine district of Sikasso as well as from growers in the nearby villages. She sells at the big market of Sikasso and from her home to a customer base composed of men and women, for cash. She plans to achieve a monthly income of 25,500 West African Francs, a part of which will be used to help her husband provide for the everyday family needs and the rest reinvested in her business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pour acheter des oranges

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El Sr. Daniel B. de 25 años, esta soltero, vive con sus padres.
   Daniel se dedica a este rubro de ventas de celulares y accesorios hace 5 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2.005; el comenzó trabajando con su padre en su negocio, después  decidió independizarse, sus estudios le favorecía, fue a comprar celulares para vender y ofrecía reparaciones en su local, en la actualidad ya tiene su clientela formada.
   El utilizaría este crédito para comprar más mercadería, (celulares y accesorios para celulares).
Más adelante desea ampliar el negocio, en vender artículos de informática.
texts.en:
Sr. Daniel B. is 25 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He has been selling mobile phones and accessories for five years, since 2005. Daniel started working at his father’s business, but he later decided to become independent and pursue an education. He bought mobile phones to sell and offered repair services from his own shop where he has an established customer base.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise (mobile phones & accessories). Later on he wants to expand his business by selling computer supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase mobile phones & accessories

loans.name: Carmen Giovanna

texts.es: Carmen Tiene 34 años, ella tiene ya 3 años en el negocio de venta de productos de belleza y perfumeria, negocio que le permite tener buenos ingresos los mismos que ahorra para  poder comprar gran variedad de mercaderia, por ello solicita el crédito a fin de lograr su sueño, ella tiene su hijo que está en edad escolar, ella sueña con poder mejora la calidad de vida de su familia, por lo cual se esfuerza y trabaja mucha par conseguir sus anhelos, se le brinda el crédito por contar con capacidad de pago y buenas referencias personales.
texts.en: Carmen is 34 years old and she already has 3 years in the business of selling beauty products and perfumes, a business that has allowed her to earn a good income and buy a variety of merchandise.  She is requesting a loan to achieve her dream.  She has a son who is school-age and she dreams to be able to improve her family's quality of life. That is why she tries hard and works a lot in order to reach her goals. Good personal references and repayment capacity qualify her for the loan.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong K., 38, is widowed and resides with a child in Bonteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Temples complex near Siem Reap province. K. sells dessert and Chinese noodle, earning an income of USD 5 per day. The family has to spend USD 50 on food, USD 50 on the kid’s education, and USD 15 on other necessary expenses every month.  K. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old married man living with his wife. He is from Lebanon. He has made his living as a professional home painter for almost 10 years now. He works on a freelance basis upon request of the clients and he also takes home projects. His business income is an important source of support for his family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business by purchasing paints and painting tools in order to be able to take on more projects and increase his business level. In the future, he hopes to open a paint shop and where he will have two parallel jobs, selling paint and also working on projects.

loans.use: purchasing paints and painting tools

loans.name: Pong

texts.en:
Pong V. is 28 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh City. He is married with one child who is attends public school. His wife works in a garment factory and has a monthly salary that is used to provide for the family’s needs. 

Pong V. is currently working as a soldier. He is concerned that he is hardly working and his wife dreams of having a vehicle to go to work, but he doesn’t have the money to buy one. Therefore, Pong V. is requesting a loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle to use to commute to work. The remainder of his loan will be used to repair his house.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorcycle and for house repairs

loans.name: Paulino

texts.pt:
Paulino M. nasceu no Distrito de Milange, Província da Zambezia, centro de Moçambique casado pai de 6 filhos ja maiores de idade. Fez 3ª classe não continuou porque foi incorporado no serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com sua a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Milange para Tanzânia na formação militar, mais tarde volta a Maputo, Moçambique para continuar com a sua formação como militar. Atualmente é pensionista do Ministério da Defesa ha mais de 18 anos, e recebe 4.136.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (varões de ferro, chapas de zinco, cimento e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Paulino M. was born in Milange District, Zambezia Province, located in central Mozambique.  He is married and has six grown-up children.  He completed the 3rd grade but did not continue because he was drafted into obligatory military service.  He lives in his own home with his family and does not support anyone else.

He left Milange for Tanzania with the corps, he returned to Maputo, Mozambique so he could continue his military training.  He has received a pension from the Ministry of Defense for more than 18 years.  From this, Paulino receives 4,136 MZN per month, which he uses to pay for household expenses.  He also manages to save some in his bank account.

Paulino has never had loans from other banks.  He found out about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution.  This is his first loan with Hluvuku.  Paulin is requesting 15,000 MZN, which he will use to buy construction material (rebar, galvanized roofing sheets, cement, etc.) to continue building his house.

He promises to pay back the loan on time in order to be able to request more loans in the future.  He plans to ask for new loans to furnish his home.

loans.use: To buy construction material (rebar, galvanized roofing sheets, cement, etc.)

loans.name: Zina's Group

texts.en: Zina S., 54, is a widow. She has three children: Two elder sons are married and live separately and the daughter makes her living at the capital. Two years ago, out of the proceeds from selling strawberries, the woman purchased a cow. Now she is keeping a cow and her calf; concurrently, she is an employee of a spinning factory. Zina has the duties of a sorter. In order to increase cattle stock, she wants to obtain a bull. For this purpose, Zina hopes to get a loan. In the future, her plans include her business development, the sale of her apartment and the buying of a house. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 33-year-old, married man who lives with his family that consists of six members. In 2005, Mahmoud opened his own store in which he produces his own dairy products and all types of cheese. He hopes that through this loan, he will be able to buy modern machines and equipment for his store to increase the size of production, which will increase his income and allow him to have a successful business.

loans.use: To buy modern machines and equipment

loans.name: Wilmer Omar

texts.es: El señor Wilmer se dedica a la producción de escarchadores ( escobillones ) ya se dedica a esta actividad hace siete años ya cuenta con clientela propia a quienes entrega sus productos semanalmente el trabajo lo realiza de lunes a viernes y entrega los escarchadores los días sábados (a ferreterías de Cochabamba y Quillacollo),  Wilmer es soltero y aun vive en domicilio de propiedad de sus padres, a quienes colabora con los gastos familiares, solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de escobillones, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Wilmer's business is making cleaning brushes.  He has been in this business for seven years and he already has customers to whom he delivers his products on a weekly basis.  He works making his products from Monday to Friday and delivers them on Saturdays (to hardware stores in Cochabamba and Quillacollo).  Wilmer is single and still lives with his parents who he helps with family expenses.  He is requesting this loan to buy raw materials for making his brushes.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loans.use: Working capital to buy raw materials

loans.name: Mayra Esperanza

texts.es: La señora Mayra G. M. es casada tiene un hijo el cual está en edad escolar , ella trabaja en IMFARSA como conserje, realizando la limpieza de la institución, sus créditos han sido para ir mejorando su casa ya que la tenía un poco deteriorada, por esta razón me siento agradecida por la atención brindada por CEPRODEL en mi desarrollo familiar.
texts.en: Mrs. Mayra G. M. is married, and has one school-age son. She works as a janitor at IMFARSA, cleaning the building. Her loans have been used to improve her home, as it is a bit rundown. She is thankful for the assistance provided by CEPRODEL in helping her family.

loans.use: Home improvements, purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a married woman with four children, one of whom attends high school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For over thirty years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling as retail to her local neighbours. Teresa faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to become a big supplier of vegetables in the future.

With the 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables and expand her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchasing various goods for door-to-door sales

loans.name: Gerelmaa

texts.en: Gerelmaa is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two children, aged 9 and 18, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent. Her daughter is a student while her son attends public school. Her husband is also an entrepreneur. Gerelmaa supports her family by operating two clothing retail stalls at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, with her husband. When she first began her business in 2000, she sold all types of her handmade coats at another person's stall and had 200,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) in working capital. Now her business has grown so that today, her working capital is 3,000,000 MNT. She sells clothes imported from Ereen, a border city of China, as well as her handmade clothes in her own two stalls. During these years, she has been successfully improving her life and her business. With her profits, she bought a medium-sized ger and car in 2008. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase clothing materials and more clothes from Ereen. Her goal in 2011 is to expand her business with this loan and then to be able to buy her own small house.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and clothing materials to sew coats

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem lives in a two-room brick house with her family in Mian Channu, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family for the past eight years. Her husband, M. B., works in agriculture. He is very experienced in his business and grows different crops according to the seasons and has many business contacts.

Naseem is a housewife, staying at home to fulfill household responsibilities. She has a son who is illiterate because Naseem couldn’t provide him with an education due to financial constraints. He is involved in an animal-sales business and Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her son to buy some animals in order to expand this business. With this loan, he will buy goats and sheep to raise and sell for a profit. He has many years of experience in this business and Naseem is hopeful that he will be able to get better results from his business after the loan investment. She wants him to marry as he is now 23 years old and she is hopeful that she will be able to do this very soon with the increased profits from the loan.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for resale.

loans.name: Eunia

texts.en:
Eunia O. is 38 years old.  She is from Kakamega.  She is married to Daniel and they have three children, aged 6, 10, and 8.

Eunia has a business selling ropes. She normally sells them to livestock farmers.  Eunia is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more ropes so that she can serve her clients well. The profits made will be used to cater to her family's needs.

Eunia's desire is to diversify into dairy farming in the future.

loans.use: to buy more ropes to sell

loans.name: Lesvia

texts.es:
La  señora Lesvia López López, vive en la Ribera Miguel Hidalgo Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México, es casada y tiene cinco hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad y son: Orfa, Josué, Isai, Dania Saray y Quirino Adirain.

       El préstamo que solicito es para invertirlo en la compra  y venta de pollos de rancho para luego venderlo, así como también se dedica a la venta de ropas, en esta actividad lleva  diez meses y comenta que le va bien.

      Para dedicarse a  esta actividad lo platico con su esposo para que juntos trabajen y logren tener ingresos en su hogar de igual manera  poder darle lo más necesario en sus educación.

       Lo que más desea es  que con esta actividad pueda estar trabajando, para  lograr ahorrar y así poder  seguir incrementado su negocio, aun que cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quieren darle lo mejor a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lesvia López López lives in Ribera Miguel Hidalgo in Copainala Municipality, Chiapas State, Mexico.  She’s married and has five children who are still in her care.  They are: Orfa, Josué, Isaí, Dania Saray and Quirino Adirain.

The loan she asked for will be invested in the purchase of free range chickens to resell.  She’s also been selling clothes for the last ten months and states that she’s been doing well.

She discussed going into this business with her husband so that they could work together and earn income for their home as well as provide what is necessary for their education.

What she most wants is to continue working in this activity so that she can save up and gradually enlarge her business.  Even though she has her husband’s support they want to provide the best for their children so that they will continue in school.

loans.use: to buy chickens and to buy clothes.

loans.name: Nely Marilu

texts.es:
Nely tiene 43  años de edad y vive junto a su esposo e hijo en la parte urbana del distrito de Olmos – Lambayeque.

El hijo de Nely se encarga de brindar el servicio de mototaxi en la comunidad de Olmos. Él cuenta con varios años de experiencia en este rubro, es decir conoce muy bien los recorridos de sus clientes y las calles de su distrito. 

La mototaxi es un servicio de transporte público muy común en el Perú, sobretodo en las pequeñas comunidades; consta de una moto con una cabina en la parte trasera  donde se pueden transportar pasajeros

Nely y su familia cuentan con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos y amigos, sobre todo porque  se muestran como una familia trabajadora y unida, donde cada uno de sus miembros colabora con los gastos del hogar.

Nely solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles, los cuáles destinará en la compra de repuestos para el rodaje de la moto de su hijo y además para el mantenimiento de ésta, pues sus clientes lo solicitan.  

Nely desea arreglar la moto pues quiere contar con más ingresos para lograr su meta que es comprar una mototaxi más.
texts.en:
Nely is 43 years old and she lives together with her husband and son in an urban region of the district of Olmos in Lambayeque.

Nely's son provides motorcycle transportation in the community of Olmos. He has many years' experience in the field, meaning he knows his clients' neighborhoods and the streets of the district very well. 

Motorcycle transport is a public transportation service which is very common in Peru, especially in the small communities. The vehicle consists of a motorcycle and a cabin attached to the rear section for passengers.

Nely and her family have very good personal and work-related references set forth by their neighbors and friends. They are known to be a very close and hardworking family and each of the members contribute towards the household expenses. 

Nely requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) of 1500 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of new tires for her son's motorcycle and to carry out maintenance repairs. His clients request his services.

Nely wants to repair the motorcycle to improve the household income. Her goal is to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase new tires for the motorcycle transport.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es: Epifania tiene 23  años, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada. Aprendió las técnicas agrarias y ganaderas desde que era una niña, y esto es agracias a sus padres que le enseñaron esta actividad, hoy se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos. Es así que su labor consiste en alimentar y engordar a los animales vacunos y ovinos para luego venderlos a un precio mayor que cuando lo adquirió. Su esposo es quien la ayuda en este negocio, él se dedica al traslado de los animales hasta la feria ganadera, lugar donde los exhibe para su venta. De las ganancias que percibe lo invierte en la agricultura, puesto que en su pueblo natal tiene sus extensos terrenos para cultivo, por lo que significa otra fuente de ingreso más. Ahora su prioridad es aumentar su capital de trabajo (animales), porque a mayor capital es mejor la ganancia, meta que se ha propuesto alcanzar, por ello necesita de su apoyo para cumplirlos.  Es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser puntual en sus pagos, además se muestra agradecida por la confianza hacia su persona. Con el crédito solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de más carneros.
texts.en: Epifania is 23 years old; she lives with her husband and 2 children in a rented home. She has worked in agriculture and cattle raising from a very young age thanks to her parents who taught her and today it serves as her main source of income. Epifania works feeding and fattening her animals, cattle and sheep, to sell them at a higher price than what she paid in the beginning. Her husband helps her in the business; he transports the animals to the cattle dealer market where he shows and sells them. Epifania’s profits will be invested back in agriculture which is why in her native town she has vast plots of land which means she has another source of income. At present, her priority is to increase her work capital (animals) because the more animals that she has, the more earnings she acquires which is Epifania’s goal. This is her second loan with MFP which is why she is committed to make her payments on time, she is also very grateful for the trust given to her. The loan will be used to buy more sheep.

loans.use: buy more sheep.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Ibrahim.  He is married and has 2 children aged 10 and 6. He has 1 additional dependent who lives with him because she is his niece.  

In 1996, Ibrahim established his imported foodstuff business.  When he began this business, he believed it can generate enough income to help him provide a livelihood for his family. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

Ibrahim would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to buy more imported foodstuff for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Ibrahim plans to get a building of his own and to make sure that his children are educated.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy imported foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has 3 children. 

Vilma has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

Vilma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Vilma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 58 years old and a widow with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cecilia has a home products sales business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Cecilia requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of plastic wares to sell.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of plastic wares to sell.

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en: Gulnar is single and lives with her parents. For the last five years, she has dedicated herself to agriculture. Gulnar learned the farming business from a young age from her father and now has a lot of experience. She cultivates wheat, maize, corn, tomatoes and water melons. Gulnar is requesting a loan from Kiva to invest in seeds and mineral fertilizers. With this loan she will be able to succeed and have better opportunities for the sale of her products after the harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr: L’emprunteur est un commerçant de produits alimentaires qui tient une boutique à l’entrée de la ville. Il est marié et son activité lui permet de prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille.Il supporte aussi des charges locatives et de paiement de factures d’eau et d’électricité.Il a réussi à acquérir une deuxième boutique à l’intérieur de la ville.Il a déjà obtenu deux prêts de l’IMCEC de 300000F et de 400 000F respectivement.Afin de renforcer son stock son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un troisième prêt de  500 000F pour acheter 50 sacs  de riz, 4 futs d’huile et des produits divers. Son ambition  est d’ouvrir une grande alimentation au bord de la route nationale.
texts.en:
This borrower is a grocer who has a shop at the city's entrance. He is married and his business enables him to support his family. He also covers the rent and the bills for water and electricity. He has succeeded in acquiring a second store inside the city. 

He has already had two loans with the micro-finance institution IMCEC in the amount of 300,000 francs and 400,000 francs respectively. In order to bolster his business fund, he is requesting a third loan of 500,000 francs to buy 50 sacks of rice, 4 casks of oil, and a variety of goods. His ambition is to open a large grocery store along the nation's main road.

loans.use: to buy 50 sacks of of rice, 4 casks of oil, and various products

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la señora Lisbeth; la socia es casada y tiene 42 años de edad, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 7 años de edad; la socia trabaja con su esposo desde hace 10 años en el área administrativo y venta de tractores y maquinaria pesada así como repuestos y partes para tractores y maquinarias pesadas, la socia es la mano derecha del esposo y ella particularmente se dedica  a la administración del negocio. La socia requiere le préstamo para invertir y poder apoyar al esposo que también es socio en el pago inicial de la compra de repuestos de tractores y repuestos de maquinarias pesadas, la socia trae el pedido de la ciudad de Lima y ella gira un monto base para la entrega de las diferentes partes y repuestos para la implementación de su negocio familiar. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el pago inicial de sus pedido de repuestos para tractores y repuestos de maquinarias pesadas.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Sra. Lisbeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Granito de Mostaza” (Mustard Seed) which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 42 years old, married, and has a seven-year-old son. For the past 10 years, Lisbeth and her husband have been managing a business that sells tractors and heavy machinery, as well as spare parts for this type of equipment. Lisbeth serves as her husband’s right hand and is responsible for managing the business. She needs a loan to invest and help her husband, as well as make the down payment toward the purchase of tractor and heavy machinery parts. Lisbeth brings her order to the city of Lima and pays a base amount so that different parts can be delivered and keep her family business in operation. She is requesting a loan to invest in the down payment for her order of tractor and heavy machinery parts.

Lisbeth is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to make a down payment on an order of tractor and heavy machinery parts.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 26-year-old married man with two children. His dream has been to acquire his own motorcycle rather than being hired to work for others. He lives in a semi-permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has been a hired motorcycle rider for four years. The challenge he always faces is to remit the agreed money to his boss even when he has not earned that day. John needs the loan to buy a motorcycle for transportation purposes.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for transportation purposes.

loans.name: Sulema

texts.es: Sulema tiene 28 años, vive con su hijo y su pareja en una casa alquilada. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas, actividad que le enseñaron sus padres, como el cultivar la tierra y que está produjera los frutos para el sostén familiar. Hoy es su fuente principal de ingreso economico, que con la posesión de algunos terrenos, heredados de sus padres, sigue trabajando y cultivando papa, maíz, habas, oca, arveja. A pesar de las dificultades que tuvo en anteriores siembras, debido a las variaciones climaticas, Sulema no ha dejado de trabajar, es más, tiene la esperanza de que llegaran buenos tiempos y que logrará cosechar gran parte de su producción. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, en su primera oportunidad de crédito fue una experiencia positiva para su negocio. En esta ocasión también invertirá el dinero que solicita, en la compra de sacos de abono y la preparación del terreno para lo cual arrienda  tractor.
texts.en:
Sulema is 28, and lives with her son and her partner in a rented house.  She has worked in agriculture her whole life. This is the livelihood that her parents taught her; cultivating the land, and producing crops to support the family. Today it is her main source of income.  

She owns some land, inherited from her parents, and she keeps working and growing potatoes, corn, fava beans, yams, and peas. In spite of the difficulties she had in previous plantings, due to variable weather conditions, Sulema hasn't stopped working.  She is even hopeful that good weather will arrive, and she will manage to harvest much of her production.

This is her second loan with MFP. Her first loan opportunity was a positive experience for her business. On this occasion, she will also use the money she is applying for to buy bags of fertilizer and to prepare her land for planting, for which she will rent a tractor.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer and rent a tractor.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 
Josefa has a food shop that sells banana & sweet potato cue & fried chicken intestine. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making banana cue.
Josefa is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Josefa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making banana cue

loans.name: Casimira

texts.es: Casimira tiene 23 años, convive con Yuri de 25 años, con quien tiene 01 hijo. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Puerto Cocos, Pichari. Ella es una buena y noble mujer que desde pequeña se caracterizó por su buen comportamiento y por el respeto hacia los demás. Cuando tenía 17 años terminó el colegio, pero la falta de capital hizo que no lograra seguir una carrera profesional. Sin embargo siguio adelante, e incursionó en la venta de jugos de frutas, pues como su padre cultivaba frutas, entonces vio la necesidad de forjarse un trabajo propio, es así que monta su fuente de soda, ofreciendo diversidad de jugos de frutas. en un inicio solo contaba con un poco capital y con ello compró su licuoestractora, al paso del tiempo iba amobalndo su local, hasta convertirse en un lugar agradable en el que la mayoría de los clientes van a consumir sus jugos. Ella recibe el apoyo de su esposo, quien es la persona que le trae las frutas del campo. Este será su tercer crédito, por lo que se compromete en cancelar el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1000 soles que solicita, comprará más muebles para acondicionar su local.
texts.en:
Casimira is 23 years old and lives with 25-year-old Yuri.  The couple have one child and live in their own home which is located in Puerto Cocos community, in Pichari.  Casimira is a good and honest woman who has been noted for her good behavior and her respect for other people since she was a young girl.  Casimira finished school when she was 17 but a lack of capital meant that she couldn't study for a professional degree.  However, she got ahead and started selling fruit juices.  As her father grew fruit, she saw the need to create her own job and so set up a juice bar, selling a variety of fruit juices.  At first, she only had a small amount of capital which she used to buy a juicer.  Over time, she furnished her premises and turned it into a pleasant place where her customers come to drink the juice she prepares.  Casimira receives support from her husband.  He is the one who transports the fruits from the field.

This will be Casimira's third loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.  She will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to buy more furniture for her premises.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her premises

loans.name: Hilda's Group

texts.es:
Hilda's Group está conformado por tres personas: 2 mujeres y un hombre. En este grupo Hilda es la presidenta. 

Hilda tiene 45 años vive con su hijo en La Esperanza que se encuentra a 15 minutos de Ibarra en el Norte de Ecuador. Se considera una persona trabajadora y responsable de su hijo.

Trabaja con sus sobrinas en el bordado de manteles. Es el segundo crédito que solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de materia prima como manteles, tela, hilo para bordar, lo que va a ayudar a incrementar su producción para mejorar sus ventas e ingresos. Su sueño es que su hijo sea profesional y en lo personal quiere ser una inversionista grande para poder emplear a personal.
texts.en:
Hilda's Group has three members: two women and one man.  Hilda is the group's president.

Hilda is 45 years old and lives with her son in La Esperanza, 15 minutes from Ibarra, in the north of Ecuador.  She considers herself to be a hard-working person and is responsible for her son.

Hilda works with her nieces, embroidering tablecloths.  This is the second loan she has requested from Fodemi.  She will invest it in buying raw materials such as tablecloths, fabric and embroidery thread, which will help her to increase her production so that she can improve her sales and income.  Her dream is for her son to become a professional and, on a personal level, she would like to become a big investor so that she can employ some staff.

loans.use: to buy fabric and embroidery thread

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is 50 years old and live in Barnersville. She is married and has eight children between the ages of 20 and 27 years old, seven of whom are out of high school, working and living on their own, while the younger one is currently in school and lives at home. Justina's  husband is a businessman.
For the past thirty years, she has been operating a cook shop (restaurant). She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, onion, and coal for her business. She has more customers and makes higher profits. Her plan is to build a house for her children and send them to college.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, onion and coal for her business

loans.name: Juan Santos

texts.es: Juan, se decidió de nuevo a obtener otro crédito, debido a la buena atención de nuestra institución y quiere seguir trabajando en la agricultura cosechando maíz y frijol y por eso necesita comprar fertilizantes como: abono, herbicidas, semilla, el propósito de él es que este año tener mejores cosechas y de esa forma venderlo  al mercado y obtener mejores ingresos. Los créditos anteriores le ayudaron mucho el cual saco buenas ganancias, y le  ayudo a tener mejor estabilidad económica y  mejorar las condiciones de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Juan decided again to get another loan because of our institution's good service.  He wants to continue working in agriculture growing corn and beans, so he needs to buy fertilizers such as fertilizer, herbicide, and seeds.

His goal is to have better harvests this year and in this way sell them at the market and obtain better earnings.  The previous loans helped him a lot to make a good profit and to have better financial stability and improve living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and seeds.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase his own motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita from the village of Panta-on, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Marita is married and has five adult-aged children.

To make a living, Marita own and operates a farm, planting & harvesting corn for sale. Marita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Marita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Recently Marita joined GDMPC to seek for financial Assistance as additional investment to her business. She plans to use the income generated to expand her business and portion of it will be save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Liliana Sonnia

texts.es:
Liliana de 53 años, empezó con su negocio hace aproximadamente 18 años atrás, y con la pequeña liquidación que tuvo en su antiguo trabajo decidió aumentar un poco más su tienda de víveres.

Se levanta a las 6 de la mañana y cierra por la noche. Su dificultad es la delincuencia que hay en el sector. 

Está separada de su esposo y tiene dos hijos de 32 y 27 años ya tiene su compromiso y viven en otro lados.

Su meta es poder construir un local junto a su tienda para poder establecer un bazar.
texts.en:
Liliana, age 53, started her business approximately 18 years ago.  She started with a small amount of money she had from the liquidation of her previous job.  She decided to add to her grocery store a little bit.

She gets up at six in the morning, and she closes at night.  The delinquency in the area is a difficulty for her.

She is separated from her husband.  She has two children, ages 32 and 27.  They have their engagements, and they live in other places.

Her goal is to be able to build a place alongside of her store to be able to establish a stationery store.

loans.use: to buy rice and sweets.

loans.name: Thouk

texts.en: Thouk is 56 years old.  She is married and resides with her husband and two school age children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She sells fish in the market to generate income to support the family. Her husband is a sub village leader. In order to increase her family income, Thouk is requesting a loan of $1,000 to raise capital in her business in order to buy more fish to resell at the market to get more profit. By doing so, her family's economy will be better and can support her daily living. In the future, she would like to build a kitchen and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell at the market

loans.name: Samoeurn

texts.en: Samoeurn, 53, is married and resides with her husband and eight children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a construction worker. Six of her children are employed. Two of them are soldiers, one is a garment worker, two more are construction workers and the last one is employed in Malaysia as a homemaker. Since her daughter has trouble with her transportation to work, Samoeurn is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to use to commute to work. By doing so, she can save some money from her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her husband's business to be a construction foreman. Moreover, she plans to renovate her house and support her son to study until he gets his Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her daughter

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim is taking out a loan for her daughter, Hoai, who studies Korean language at Hanoi University. With the hope of becoming a translator for a Korean firm, she is trying to develop her language skills through the professors in the university. In order to become fluent in this language, her daughter wants to use a laptop. Therefore, Kim requires a loan of 14,580,000 Vietnamese đồng (VND) to buy it.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. Roselyn has a retail shop and she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Roselyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Gs La Bendicion Group

texts.es:
La Señora María, tiene 46 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, y es madre soltera, Su actividad principal es la venta de abarroteria (pulpería) tiene 5 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio, Doña María, esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de su producto como: Arroz, manteca, jabón, azúcar, refrescos, carnes, embutidos, y otros productos para la atención de sus clientes, Doña María es una persona muy trabajadora y su negocio esta ubicado en su casas de habitación, contando con toda la clientela de la zona donde ella habita, negocio que le a ayudado a salir adelante ya que ha sido su principal fuente de ingresos, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba Doña María, le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia,
Doña María sueña con tener el  mejor negocio de la zona poderlo surtir con todo lo necesario para incrementar su clientela, y mejorar sus ingresos.
Julio, se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta agua purificada en galón, en litro y en bolsa, y la venta de mariscos como: pescado fresco, tila pía, camarón y jaiba.
Lourdes, se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de  golosinas como: pastel, pizza, tortas, flores decorativas, venta  y elaboración de juguitos.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de Arroz, manteca, jabón, azúcar, refrescos, carnes, embutidos, y otros productos para su negocio

loans.name: Monira

texts.en:
Monira is a 37 year old married woman who has 4 family members from Sahab Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 499 JD to pay for various products to sell such as clothes, blankets and housewares.In the future she would like to re-do a room in her home specifically for selling her products and she hopes to increase her income.
Monira is a conservative woman,she is unwilling to upload her photo in the internet the photo is for her husband

loans.use: to pay for various products to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en: James was born in Kaya village, Siaya County, in Western Kneya. He is married with children and is engaged in retail small scale business. James wants to make a difference in his community and town of Siaya by engaging community health outreach programme run by a Community Based Organization CBO in the district. He has also committed to spend most of his free time with the CHW counseling the youth on avoiding anti social practices, drug abuse and AIDs/HIV prevention. James is happy to own his own motorcycle and is ready to give back to the community the free tranport services to CHW. James will also use the income generated from his motorcycle business to support his family he plans to buy another motorcycle and support more CHWs and other community work in future

loans.use: To Purchase a Motorcycle to Support Community Health Workers and for Micro-Transport Business

loans.name: Kisinsiima Abeteraine Group

texts.en:
Noeline is a 43-year-old married woman living in Kagadi, Uganda. She has been growing maize and beans to earn a living. She hopes to educate her children despite price fluctuations leading to low returns on her sales.

Noeline is requesting a loan to buy maize for planting. She is a member of Kisinsiima Abeteraine Group, where each member guarantees the other to get a loan, since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy maize for planting.

loans.name: Iyubare Group

texts.en:
Léonard fait partie du groupe  Iyubare  et  habite à  Gitega. Il  a 36 ans et est marié à Rose, une  cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 5 à 11 ans, dont 4 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce du riz, du haricot,…dans sa boutique  depuis 6 ans. 

Il est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter   beaucoup  de kilos de riz et de haricot à revendre  pour gagner plus.

loans.use: il va  augmenter son capital et acheter   beaucoup  de kilos de riz et de haricot à revendre  pour gagner plus.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has one child who goes to school. She takes care of additional family members. She has operated a restaurant at the market for some years, working seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy beef, bunches of green bananas, cooking oil, and beans. Her challenges include seasonality of food. She would like to build rental houses. She lives in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.
Repayment History

loans.use: To buy beef, bunches of green bananas, cooking oil,flour, and beans

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: I started this business years ago and it has helped me take care of my family. I know how to safe guide my capital to ensure continuity in business.  All these are words of Mrs. Rosemary E.. She is requesting for $500 to expand her business.

loans.use: Sales of foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase taioring equipment and expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow for his dairy farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her little café and green-grocery

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth J. is 47 years old, married and the mother of five children. She is a leader in one of LAPO's unions.  She runs a business selling provisions and producing nylon. This business, which she runs with her husband, enable her to pay for family expenses. She has 14 years of experience in this business.  She is requesting for a loan of US $550 to buy more provisions and materials needed to produce nylon.

loans.use: to buy more provisions and materials for the production of nylon

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
María Guadalupe is a mother of 3 boys and a wife who desires to contribute to her family's income, since her husband's salary is low. She was convinced that she needed to work to keep her family going; she started to look for a type of business that would still allow her to fulfill her duties at home and earn extra money. An acquaintance selling lingerie approached María so she could refer her to her neighbors. This is how María came to sell lingerie and gain some customers, little by little.

Today, she has a number of customers but María has no money to stock up. Thus, she is requesting a loan of $375, which will be repaid in installments over 6 months. The loan will be used to buy more lingerie to sell to her new customers who are asking for different types. With your help, María will be able to offer more and have better products to sell so she can advance in life. Many thanks!

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

María Guadalupe, una madre de tres hijos y esposa que desea ayudar a los ingresos familiares, puesto que en el trabajo de su esposo no le pagan bien. Convencida de que ella necesita trabajar para poder sacar adelante su hogar, comenzó a buscar qué tipo de negocio le podría ayudar para no descuidar su casa y obtener ingresos extras. Un familiar se acercó a ella ofreciendole lencería para que ella la ofrezca a sus vecinas, y fue así como comenzó a vender y a hacerce poco a poco de clientas.

Hoy tiene una cantidad moderada de clientas que le piden mercancía pero no tiene dinero para surtirla por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito por US $375 para pagarlo en un plazo de 6 meses y con ese dinero María podrá comprar más lencería para ofrecerle a sus nuevas clientas que le están pidiendo variedad. Con tu ayuda María podrá ofrecer más y mejores productos para vender, y así ella podrá salr adelante. ¡Muchas Gracias!

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru:
Firuza is married and has one child. Her husband is working in Russia, and Firuza trades at the market. She rents a small store where she sells warm blankets and household goods. She is hoping to receive a loan from MicroInvest-Tajikistan in order to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Firuza замужем, имеет 1 ребенка. Ее муж на заработках в России, а Фируза выходит на рынок торговать. Она арендует маленький магазинчик где продает теплые одеяла и различные товары для дома. Она собирается получить займ в Микроинвест для расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Roeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Roeung C., 27, is a mother of three little children and works as a tailor at her home. She makes a profit of about $2 each day. Her husband is employed at a private company and typically makes around $5 each day.

Mrs. Roeun C. requests this loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for her family’s transportation. This will save money for her family, because she and her husband will no longer have to hire a taxi. They waste a lot of money every month on taxi costs.

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle for her family's transportation

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is married, but does not have children. She is a trained nurse and the proprietor of Mombasa Royal Medical Clinic based in Shinyalu Kakamega, Kenya. The clinic offers general curative, family planning, child welfare, and laboratory services. The locals appreciate the quality of services provided in Florence's facility. Florence is asking for a loan of US$1,200 to further expand her clinic.

loans.use: Facility expansion

loans.name: Bano's Group

texts.en:
I am Bano Z. N., a mother of eight children who lives with my family in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. Two of my daughters are married and the others attend school. To make a living, I sell cloth from my house to the women in my neighborhood. I need a loan to expand my inventory and improve my income.

My group members in need of loans are: Mehnaz B., who will buy cardboard with her share of loan, Bhoola B., who wants to buy a sewing machine; Razia B. will use her share of the loan to repair their rickshaw; Samia B. needs this loan to buy paints and brushes for her family’s paint business.

These women reside in my neighborhood and I completely trust them. Please help us by lending immediately as we do not want to miss good business opportunities.

loans.use: Buy cloth in bulk

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en: Amanda A. is a 42 year-old resident of the Fise community of Greater Accra with 4 children.  She has over 4 years of experience in the sale of traditional cloth, including those she imports from nearby Togo.  She would like to expand the inventory of  her shop in central Accra with a loan of $600 (8 months).

loans.use: Amanda would use the loan to expand the inventory of her business.

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es:
Mario lives in the Santa Rosa neighborhood. He is 42 years-old, married, and has four children who are 6, 8, 10, and 13 years old. His wife works as a domestic employee to help support the family. Mario sells school supplies and also does repairs and painting. He opened his business two years ago with his own money. He would like to own his repair shop rather than rent the space as he does now. In the future, he would like to buy tools for his repair shop. He would like to increase his income to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Mario habita en el barrio Santa Rosa, tiene 42 años de edad, es casado le tienen cuatro hijos entre 6, 8,10 y 13 años de edad, su esposa trabaja como domestica para ayudar al hogar. El Sr. Mario vende artículos escolares y también trabaja en enderezado y pintura el comenzó su negocio con dinero propio y tiene dos años de experiencia. El préstamo lo quiere para instalar su taller en un local propio ya que el que tiene es alquilado. Sus planes a futuro es comprar herramientas de trabajo para el taller. Incrementar sus ingresos para tener un nivel de vida mejor.

loans.use: Opening of his Own Shop

loans.name: Ubaldo

texts.es:
Ubaldo Morrel is a married man with four children; two of whom attend university and the other two go to secondary school. From the point of view of Ublando, the education of his children is his priority in life and he works hard to be able to pay for the schooling of his four children.

The family has two different sources of income. The wife is the owner of a small grocery store which offers a diverse quantity of products, while Ublado works in a company. The money provided by the loan will be used to purchase flour, noodles, rice, and other things.

Both of them are hardworking and honest people with a great desire to overcome. For quite some time they have worked with the Foundation, demonstrating seriousness, responsibility, and punctuality in payment.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Ubaldo M. es un señor casado con 4 hijos, de los cuales dos van a la universidad y otros dos al colegio. Desde el punto de vista de Ublando la educación de sus hijos es su prioridad de visa, entonces trabaja duramente para poder pagar los estudios de los cuatro hijos.

La familia tiene dos fuentes de ingreso distintas. La señora es dueña de una despensa donde ofrece una diversa cantidad de productos, mientras que Ubaldo trabaja en una compañía. El dinero proveído por el crédito será utilizado para la compra de harina, fideos, arroz entre otros.

Son personas muy trabajadoras y honestas, con un gran deseo de superación. Trabajan con la Fundación desde hace bastante tiempo, demostrando seriedad, responsabilidad y puntualidad en los pagos,

loans.use: To purchase flour, noodles and rice among other things

loans.name: Urbano Héctor

texts.es:
Urbano is a hard-working man dedicated to watching out for the welfare of his family. He assumed this great responsibility by generating income doing farm work. He plants and cultivates tubers such as potatoes and varieties of grains and profits from their sale. This year, Urbano wants to improve his production record for each harvest in order to settle his home expenses and the expenses for his son’s studies. Collaborate with Urbano and together you can improve his production record.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Don Urbano es un hombre muy trabajador, dedicado a velar por el bienestar de su familia, esa gran responsabilidad la asumió generando ingresos en las tareas del campo. Siembra y cultiva tubérculos como la papa y otras variedades de granos, obteniendo ganancias con la venta de los mismos. Este año, Don Urbano desea superar su propio record de producción para cada cosecha, y así poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y los estudios del menor de sus hijos. Colabora con Urbano, y juntos podrán superar su record de producción.

loans.use: Capital to purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in clothing and costume jewelry for a small business.

loans.name: Nofal

texts.en: Nofal is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. He settled in the Fizuli region in the Geca Gozlu village. Nofal was born in 1956, is married, and has 4 children. He has been in the cattle breeding business for 10 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy 2 calves.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Doña Dolores tiene 38 años de edad, estudió cuarto de primaria, es conviviente y madre de seis hijos (uno casado y cinco solteros menores de edad). Vive en el Jr. Tupac Amaru s/n, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao, Puno.

Por falta de capital decidió integrar el Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” en Mazocruz. Desde esa fecha se dedicaba a la venta de comida y con su crédito inicial pudo comprar papa, verduras, carne, etc. 

Dolores se quedó huérfana de madre a los 06 años de edad, creció al lado de su padre y a los 15 años de edad se fue a la ciudad de Arica a trabajar. Cuando cumplió 20 años de edad convivió con su esposo y empezó a vender comida,  y jugo de frutas, también compraba carne en degollados y vendía por kilos en la feria de Mazocruz. Una vez que acumularon capital instalaron una heladería, la cual hasta la fecha sigue en actividad.

Con este crédito de S/.1,500 Nuevos Soles, el cual será pagado en 04 cuotas, comprará 07 alpacas para la venta en carne, tanto al por mayor como al por menor.

Su sueño es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Tacna y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Dolores is 38 years old, studied up to fourth grade, lives with her common-law husband and is the mother of six children (one is married and five are minors). She lives on Jr. Tupac Amaru, in the district of Mazocruz, province of El Collao, Puno. Because she needed capital, she decided to join the "Generación 2000" Communal Bank in Mazocruz. Since that time she has been selling meals and with her first loan was able to buy potatoes, vegetables, meat, etc. Dolores´s mother died when she was 6 years old and she was raised by her father. When she was 15 she went to the city of Arica to work. When she was 20 she began living with her husband and began selling meals and fruit juices. She also bought slaughtered meat which she sold by the kilo in the market at Mazocruz. Once she had enough money saved, she started selling ice cream, which she continues doing today. With this loan for S/.1,500 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy 7 alpacas in order to sell the meat both wholesale and retail. Her dream is to buy a house in the city of Tacna and that her children study.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 7 alpacas.

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.en: Komiljon M. is married and has two children.  As the chief of his family, Komiljon is responsible for feeding his wife and children, and therefore started a business selling men's clothes.  He purchases the goods from another city twice each week and resells them in the market near his house.  In order to purchase more goods and increase the number of clients attracted to his business, Komiljon is requesting a loan of $1200.

loans.use: To purchase more cloths for resale.

loans.name: Ong

texts.en: Ong N. R., 21, is single and lives with her old mother and father in the Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She runs a small business, washing cars and motorbikes, and can make about US$3 per day. Because the machine that helps increase the water pressure is broken, Ong N. R. currently needs a loan to fix it, since the car washing business is the family's main source of income.

loans.use: Repair of a water pressure machine

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
This is Agnes B., age forty-two. Agnes was born in Kabala, Koinadugu district, in northern Sierra Leone. She currently resides in Makeni where she is married and runs her business. Her husband is a teacher and they have four children. Two of the children are in secondary school and two are in primary school. Agnes sells both “gara lappers” (locally dyed cloth with fabricated designs) and eggs. She has been in business for over ten years now. This will be her very first loan through SMT. She is requesting a loan of SSL 2,000,000 to help her strengthen her business.

With this loan, Agnes will expand her business by buying more goods to add to her current stock. She will invest part of the loan in her gara lapper business and part into her egg business. She purchases the eggs in Freetown for SSL 100,000 per carton. The fare to Freetown is SSL 24,000 round trip. There is a SSL 1000 delivery charge for each carton of eggs transported with her from Freetown. 

She buys the materials used for making gara lappers – inks, soda, white cotton material, etc. – here in Makeni.  A piece of white cotton cloth costs her SSL 95,000 in Makeni. She estimates she will be able to get at least nine cartons of eggs and seven pieces of white cotton cloth with the loan.  She will use the balance of the loan to buy inks, soda, and powder and to pay designers to design the white cotton cloth in different styles and patterns. 

Though business on the whole is going fine for Agnes, she does, however, face two great challenges – bad debtors and sometimes slow sales. Some of her customers refuse to pay her on time while some do not repay their debts at all. This instills fear in her as a businesswoman, making it a challenge for her to know who to trust and who not to trust.

With this loan she receives through SMT, Agnes is expecting a vast improvement in her business and an incremental increase in the amount of profit she makes. The increase in profit will be reinvested into the business, some will be saved for future use and the remainder will be used to assist her husband in providing food for their household.

loans.use: To purchase supplies of cloth making material and eggs

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Mohammad has owned a bakery for seven years. Mohammad has an oven, and he sells mankoucheh. He is known for his good and very tasty mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza. The most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Mohammad requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) in order to purchase flour, pay school tuition, and pay off his debts. This is the first time that Mohammaad has requested a loan.

Mohammad is known for his work because he makes very good and tasty mankoucheh. His clients can be anybody. When he first started his business, he faced the difficulty of finding clients. He decided on doing this business because he had good experience. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase flour, pay school tuition, and pay off his debts.

loans.name: Maria Jacinta

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Maria es viuda, tiene 50 años y 2 hijos, Maria tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donde vende verduras variadas, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Maria se dedica a la agricultura de verduras.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapallo, ajo, cebolla.
Los sueños de Maria son ayudar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y tengan negocios propios.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Marcela Community Bank. She is a 50-year-old widow with two children. She has a post at the Nery García market where she sells a variety of vegetables every day of the week. Furthermore, Maria also takes part in the cultivating of the vegetables. She is requesting a loan of 1,050 soles, which she plans to use for the purchase of pumpkin, garlic and onion. Her dreams are for her children to be professionals and have their own businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pumpkins, garlic and onions

loans.name: Glicilda

texts.en:
Glicilda is an entrepreneur married to a security guard, Joselito Ordonez. They were blessed with two children namely, Jocelle Sherwin, 21 years old, a first-year college student and Gliejel Carouzziel, 14 years old,a junior high school student. Their kids are studying here in the province and they live with them happily. Her children also accompany Glicilda in the store during weekends, which makes Glicilda thankful of having them in life.

In the past few years Glicilda had engaged in a rolling business selling assorted goods in the village but currently she maintains her village store, which is easier to manage than roaming from house to house to roll her assorted goods in the village and it has been a big help to them especially in providing her children’s allowances for school. Glicilda is again striving to expand another business, wholesaling vinegar and soy sauce to be delivered to different village stores near them. Thus, she wants to take a loan amounting to PHP 13,000 as business additional capital. Simply committing everything to God, and simply working hard to achieve such an endeavor is an easy way out of the dilemma of poverty, said Glicilda.

loans.use: To expand business capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy palm nut and rent a store for inventory

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en: Hanna M. is 52 years old and an unmarried mother of one child. Her child is currently working. She lives in the central part of Ghana, where there are lots of tourist attractions such as Kakum, park, castles etc. And this has drawn many foreigners into the country to have a feel of them. Hannah became single a long time ago when her husband left her. She is now old but walks and does her things very actively just like a teenager. To support her child, she has been hawking and trading in cosmetics sales in her neighborhood to her loyal clients. She says selling cosmetics is very lucrative. Therefore, she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income so she can open a store.
