It is her heart's desire that with the loan she can make a tremendous business transformation. Hannah belongs to a village bank called ‘Independence’.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат - молодая женщина 27 лет. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Имеет высшее образование. Занимается продажей детской одежды в торговом центре "Бадри Мунир". В пятницу выходит на рынок "Джума-базар" а в воскресенье на рынок "Якшанбе-базар".  Малохат закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Малохат кредитуется в нашей организации 1 год. Она старается расширять свой бизнес и поэтому она собирается взять кредит для расширения своего ассортимента.
texts.en:
Malohat is a young, 27-year-old woman. She is a married mother of two children. She has a higher education. Malohat is involved in sales of children’s clothing at the Badri Munir shopping center. She comes out to the Djuma-bazar market on Fridays and to the Yakshanbe-bazar market on Sundays. Malohat buys her goods at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. She has been a client at our organization for 1 year. Malohat is trying to grow her business and plans to obtain this loan in order to expand her goods assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Independientes
Luisa es casada  tiene 67 años, cinco hijos todos son mayores y están casados.
Luisa trabajaba en el  mercado de surquillo vendiendo ropa interior,  era ambulante, lo municipales  le prohibieron las ventas, ella tuvo que dejar de vender y se fue a su casa, allí tuvo la idea de poner un bazar y vender  la  mercadería que tenia. 
Luisa necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles para la compra de cosas para su bazar
Desde que está  en Finca, aprendió a no endeudarse, a ser precavida, le gusta pertenecer al Bancomunal por los prestamos que dan, y por que tiene amigas las cuales comparten momentos de camaradería. 
El sueño de Luisa es viajar a ver a sus hijas que están en Italia.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the Mujeres Independientes (Independent Women) Community Bank. Luisa is married, is 67 years old and has five children, all of whom are older and are married. Luisa used to work in the Surquillo (a district in Lima) market selling underwear on foot. However, the municipality prohibited her sales. She had to give up selling and return home where she had the idea to start a store and sell the merchandise she had from there. Luisa needs a loan of 1,800 soles in order to purchase items for her store. Since joining FINCA, she has learned to avoid debt, be cautious, and she enjoys belonging to her community bank due to the loans it gives and because she has friends who share moments of comradery. Luisa's dream is to travel to see her daughters who are in Italy.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Luisa needs a loan of 1,800 soles in order to purchase items for her store

loans.name: Yigitali

texts.ru: Баротов Йигитали- мужчина 42 лет. Женат и отец 3-х детей.  Йигитали занимается откормоми  купле-продажей скота . Он закупает скот и продает сразу же, если найдется хороший клиент. Или продает через 3-4 месяца. Таким образом Йигитали зарабатывает на жизнь и оборачивает свой капитал. Ему помогают сыновья. Йигитали нам  благодарен за    финансовую помощь.
texts.en:
Yigitali B. is 42 years old, married and a father of three children. Yigitali feeds and sells cattle. He purchases animals and will sell them right away if he finds a good client or keeps them for 3-4 months and sells them for a better price. Yigitali makes his living this way and his sons help him in this business. He is very grateful for the financial help Kiva has offered.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Abduchalil

texts.ru: Абдучалил Хамидов проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 40 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Абдучалил имеет торговую точку, где более 7 лет занимается торговлей. Он покупает овец, расчленяет и продает их как мясо. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы купить несколько овец.
texts.en:
Abduchalil H. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. Abduchalil has a retail store, where he has been selling for over 7 years. He buys sheep, slaughters it and sells the meat. Our client is requesting this loan in order to buy a few sheep.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza  es social del Bancomunal 24 de 0ctubre
Maritza es casada, tiene 45 años dos hijos de 16  y 7 años que estudian en la escuela estatal Francisco Bolognessi en San Juan.  
Maritza tiene una bodega, pero  en la misma cuadra han abierto otra bodega y las ventas ya no es el mismo, ella ha visto  la posibilidad de poner un negocio de bazar   en el callao y quiere implementarlo. 
Necesita un crédito de 800 soles,  para la compra de ropa de bebe.
El sueño que tiene es tener otra tienda, un bazar y ver a su hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Maritza is a partner at the October 24th Village Bank. Maritza is married, 45 years old, and has two children who are 16 and 7 years old and study at the Francisco Bolognessi state school in San Juan. Maritza has a grocery store, but on the same block another grocery store has opened so her sales aren’t the same anymore. She has seen the possibility of putting a general goods store in Callao and she wants to set one up. She needs a loan of 800 soles to buy baby clothing. Her dream is to have another store – a general goods store - and to see her children have careers.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baby clothing

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 42 years old and is married with three children. She sells provisions and drinks to the people within her community in Benin City.

Sarah hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Sothen Pha Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank Group consists of 21 people in Chrou Pisei village in Kandal province.  The members of the group selected Mrs. Sothen P. for their leader. She is 35 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school.

Mrs. Sothen P. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice for a living. In this plantation, she now faces a problem with plowing so she decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field in order to grow rice. 

Her husband, Mr. P. Sipho, is a motorbike taxi driver and he also helps his wife on the rice plantation. 

The other members will use their loans for different purposes. All the members are in the picture but some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field in order to grow rice.

loans.name: Juana Pilar

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Juana es casada, tiene 50 años y 6 hijos, Juana viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. venD. verduras, frutas y D. las ferias compra cereales, carne, quesos, productos que venD. en los mercados. Además Juana se dedica a la crianza D. animales.
Juana necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cereales y cerdo.
Los sueños D. Juana son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener un puesto en el mercado.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank, "Arco Iris." She is married, is 50, and has 6 children. She travels to the different markets in the region where she sells vegetables and fruits. At the markets, she buys cereals, meat, and cheese, which she sells at the markets. Juana also raises animals. She needs a loan of 2000 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of cereals and pork. Her dreams are to see her children become professionals and to have a stand in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cereals and pork.

loans.name: Ganiru

texts.en: Ganiru is 44 years old and married with 4 children. He sells tyres and has been in the business for a long time. He hopes for the amount of N50,000 to purchase more tyres to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more tyres to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des fils de couture et des fils de tricotage

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en:
Iyabo is a tailor in her community in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She also sells colorful sarongs. She is 34 years old and married with five children.

Iyabo hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna N. is a 58-year-old widow who lives with her eight children in Caloocan City. Lorna has been tending her general store for twenty-seven years now. She also cooks and sells food and is earning more than P14,000 a month. Much of her profits goes to her grandsons’ needs, but she also saves for herself. Lorna has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative for four years and the loans provided by the cooperative help her pursue her business. She is now on her 12th loan and has applied for a new loan of P20,000 as additional capital. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her businesses

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa M. is from the village of Block 14 Lot 1, NHA Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 43 years old. Nimfa is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nimfa owns & operates a specialized retail business selling dried fish, oils and used clothing products in the local community. Nimfa has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Nimfa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nimfa is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nimfa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Fatumah

texts.en: Fatumah is a 50 years old, married, and has seven children aged between 15 and 32 years. Three of her children go to school. She owns and lives in a six room house with eleven people. Fatumah takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and no piped water and gets three meals a day. She incurs transport costs to and from buying vegetables and fruits from Nakawa Market to her stall in the Naguru Kasenke Zone.  She works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She works seven days a week. She receives an average of thirty customers a day and sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale. Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees for her children. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality She has been in this business for fifteen years and with MCDT for seven years servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group mates. Fatumah joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, mangoes and jack fruits. She aspires to see her business grower bigger and starts selling on wholesale only and also going directly to farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary H. is currently in the business of selling fresh vegetables in a market and is requesting a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.  Mary is 30 years old and married.  Her husband is a teacher. She has 5 school-age children.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Yusufjon

texts.en:
Yusufjon is a hard-working entrepreneur from Khujand, Tajikistan. He is married with two children. He has operated his own business of producing wooden doors and window frames for the past six years. Yusufjon has extensive experience in this field and his skills are very much in demand. He works hard to earn a good income and support his family.

Yusufjon has requested a loan of $1100 to buy some tools that he needs for his business. Yusufjon appeals to your generosity so that he can improve his family's living conditions. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase tools for his manufacturing business.

loans.name: Ricardo Manuel

texts.es:
Ricardo C. de 44 años, vive en una casa de cemento en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposa le ayuda con los gastos familiares vendiendo cosméticos tiene 2 hijos uno de 18 y  otro de 12 años los dos estudiando en una escuela fiscal.

Ricardo empezó hace 10 años atrás como ayudante en un negocio de radio- técnico. Poco a poco comenzó a reunir dinero y pudo instalar un pequeño taller de reparación. En la actualidad Ricardo trabaja de lunes a sábado con su hijo de 18 años arreglando radios, juegos de video y televisores. Hasta ahora no ha tenido complicaciones en su actividad.

Con el préstamo Ricardo quiere comprar un cautín, multímetro, repuestos para tener más facilidad en su negocio. En el futuro quiere ampliar su taller y poder construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Ricardo C. is 44 years old and lives in a cement house in the Paraíso neighborhood of Guyaquil. His wife helps him with family expenses by selling cosmetics. They have two children, 18 and 12. They both are studying at a legal school. Ten years ago Ricardo started as an assistant in a radio repair shop. Little by little he gathered up enough money and built a small repair shop of his own. Currently Ricardo works from Monday to Saturday with his 18-year old son repairing radios, video games, and televisions. He has not had any problems with his business so far. With the loan Ricardo wants to buy a soldering iron, a multimeter, and spare parts to improve his business. In the future he would like to add on to his shop and make improvements on his home.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soldering iron, multimeter, and spare parts

loans.name: Formarah

texts.en:
E. was born in 1970 and is the single mother of two children. She lives in mile three at Nkwen, Bamenda, Cameroon. E. lost the father in 2001, thus making life difficult for her and her children since her father was the sole breadwinner of the house and took care of the health and education of the children.

She plans to invest this money in clothes and shoes. She has been involved in this business for a long time, therefore giving her a good background in managing the business.

Her activity will help the community to obtain dresses at a reduced cost.  She plans to use the profit to buy feed, educate, and fight poverty at home.

About GHAPE

The Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

loans.use: To buy used clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Kokadjiè Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Kokadjiè ont en moyenne  36 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Bouwere, un des villages de la sous-préfecture de Konobougou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font essentiellement le commerce d’articles divers tels l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires, de fruits, de grains de céréales et  d’habillements.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  3 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Kokadjiè sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé, pour constituer un stock de condiments alimentaires et acheter 3 douzaines d’habits pour enfants et femmes. 
Elles s’approvisionnent  à Bamako (capitale du Mali) et à Konobougou auprès des producteurs et grossistes. Elles  effectuent leurs ventes, à Bouwere (à domicile), au marché de Konobougou ville et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de12.500FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Kokadjie group, on average, are 36 years old, have 3 children, and live with their traditional extended families in Bouwere, one of the villages in the prefecture of Konobougou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women have met through family ties, and now run a resale business of various articles such as food products, fruits, grains and clothing. After having properly reimbursed 3 previous loans, the women of the Kokadjie group are looking for their fourth loan, which will be used to build up their inventory of food supplies, as well as for the purchase of about three dozen articles of clothing for women and children. They get their supplies in Bamako (the capital of Mali) and in Konobougou from suppliers and wholesellers. They sell their articles in Bouwere (from their houses), in the market of Konobougou, as well as in the surrounding fairs, for cash and credit, to a clientele composed of both men and women. They are looking to make an average monthly profit, of 12.500 FCFA each, that will be used for expenses related to healthcare, food provisioning, and schooling expenses for their families; with the remainder being reinvested in their business operations.

Translated from French by Dina Dumenko, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various articles for resale

loans.name: Sonia Estela

texts.es: Sonia Estela tiene 39 años de edad, su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de cosa de horno, hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que se hace cargo de su familia. Ella dio a este negocio porque necesitaba un medio que le generara ingresos necesarios. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la elaboración de sus productos como mantequilla, leña, queso, maíz entre otros. Ella sueña con ampliar su local para tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Sonia Estela is 39 years old. She produces and sells baked goods to earn a living. Sonia has been in this business for five years as a means of supporting her family. She started this business because she needed a way to generate necessary income.

Sonia is currently requesting a loan to buy supplies and ingredients used in making her products, such as butter, firewood, cheese, corn, and other items. Her dream is to expand her establishment so that she can generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase butter, firewood, cheese, corn, and other items

loans.name: Maqsoodan's Group

texts.en:
Maqsoodan has been a citizen of a city called Borewala, in Pakistan for the past 25 years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. She is a 40-year-old woman and continuously devotes herself to a sewing business. Her clientele base lives in her community. She receives orders and returns them on time. She is an expert in making designer and non-designer clothes. She does this work to meet the family's expenses together with her husband. Her husband's name is M. S. and he is a loader, transporting items  such as cement and bricks on his donkey cart. He has fifteen years of experience in this business. Currently, his cart has become broken down and rotted in different areas. Therefore, Maqsoodan is applying for a loan to buy a new donkey cart for her husband so he can better perform his duties. 

Maqsoodan has two other ladies in her loan group. Sakina and Muniran each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna C. is from the village of Poblacion, Siayan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 48 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Lorna owns and operates a general store. This is not the only means for generating revenue since the main source of income for the family comes primarily from the income of her husband as a farmer. Lorna has been engaged in her business for ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lorna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory, used as working capital and, most especially, used for the education of her two children. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and for the future of her children. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell and for the education of her children

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang S. is 23 years old and lives with his parents in the Takeo Province. He is not married yet and work as a veterinarian. In addition, he is has a business making rice wine and raising chickens. On average, he makes US $5.00 per day. 

Neang S. is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase rice and buy more tools to make rice wine.

loans.use: To buy rice and tools to make rice wine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy generic pharmaceutical products

loans.name: People Of Faith Group

texts.en:
Annie C., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called People Of Faith. A 28-year-old single mother of two children, 8 and 10 years old, she was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulties.

For five years, Annie has been selling soap, candles and detergents at the Redlight Market in Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more soap, candles and detergents. Describing herself as hardworking, her dream is to grow her business and to continue to support her family so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Koisee is inset at lower right because he was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more soap, candles and detergents.

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en:
Lorina is a married woman with six children, all adults. She has been selling fish retail from home for over thirty years, her other sources of income being from her children.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she hopes to renovate her selling stall and modify her selling box. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She express her aim of venturing into the larger market and getting more customers, hence making more profits.

Lorina would like to employ workers and add two branches for selling fish in future. She joined Yehu to get the loan to empower her to achieve her goals. She rents a house with electricity but no piped water. She said that food and medical bills are her greatest monthly expenses.

loans.use: To renovate her stall and modify the selling box

loans.name: Umgima

texts.en:
Umgima S. is currently in the business of selling various items in a shop such as bags of salt, sugar, boxes of soap, biscuits, etc. and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of sugar and salt to sell.  Umgima is 40 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Waylita

texts.en:
Waylita R. is from the village of Poblacion, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 57 years old. Waylita is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Waylita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Waylita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Waylita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Waylita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Waylita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette C. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo. She is 33 years old. Bernadette is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Bernadette owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Bernadette has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Bernadette joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernadette has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Bernadette is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Bernadette from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cloth.

loans.name: Nuon's Group

texts.en:
Trapeang Angk village in Takeo province has five people who have selected Mrs. Nuon M. as group leader. They are taking out a group loan and each will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Nuon M. was born in 1961. She is a farmer who owns a 0.5-hectare (1.25-acre) plot of land she uses to cultivate rice, not to sell, but to feed her family. Her husband is a construction worker. She is the mother of four children: one of whom is a construction worker, while another one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others are attending school. Although Mrs. Nuon M. and her husband work hard, they earn very little money to support their family. So, to improve her family's standard of living, Mrs. Nuon M. is asking for a loan to start a new business raising piglets.

loans.use: To buy some piglets

loans.name: Eduvigis

texts.es:
Eduvigis tiene 51 años es madre soltera vive con sus hijos  todos mayor de edad, en la ciudad de Paraguarí.
 
Eduvigis  se dedica a la ventas de ropas y calzados  en forma ambulante cuenta con clientela formada  vende sus sus productos por las compañías de la ciudad como Costa primera, Cerro León, Escobar y Soto, sus actvidades  diarias empiezan a muy tempranas hora de la mañana siendo que la señora se translada en colectivo de un lugar a otro.Tiene una hija que se encuentra trabajando en España, quien mensualmente le gira dinero para ayudarle a su madre.

Pretende utilizar el crédito para la compra de mercaderias ya que cuenta con muy buena oferta y de esa forma la Sra. obtendra más ganancias.
texts.en:
Eduvigis is a 51 year old single mother who lives in the city of Paraguarí with her two grown children. She sells clothing and shoes as a traveling vendor.

Eduvigis has an established customer base and sells products made by companies in the cities of Costa Primera, Cerro León, Escobar, and Soto. Her daily activities begin in the early morning hours since she has to move from one place to another. She has a daughter who works in Spain and supports her by sending remittances on a monthly basis.

Eduvigis will use this loan to buy merchandise since she has received a good offer that will help her generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & shoes

loans.name: Isabel Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Isabel Reyna V., se dedica a la fabricación de tortillas ella misma las palmea en su casa de habitación donde habita con sus 4 hijos pero ninguno depende  de ella todos son independientes.

Ella lleva ya 36 créditos con ceprodel revolventes cada dos meses los cuales los utiliza para comprar Leña, Maíz, Cal. Doña Isabel V.  ha sido muy responsable con sus obligaciones, siempre ha pagado en tiempo y forma.
texts.en:
Mrs. Isabel Reyna V. makes hand-made tortillas in her home where she lives with her four children although none of them depends on her; they are independent.

She has had 36 loans with Ceprodel that revolve every two months that she uses to buy firewood, corn and lime powder.

Mrs. Isabel V. has been very responsible with her obligations; she has always repaid on time.

loans.use: To buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Nov C., age 54, is married to Mr. Mey, age 57. He appears in the photo. She has four children, three of whom are employed as garment workers. The other one attends school. 

Her husband has been earning a living for many years. He is a porter in his community, or anywhere in the province of Kompong Tom. This family normally earns an average of $5 per day to help cover their family’s daily living expenses. The main source of income comes from her three daughters who receive a regular salary each month. 

In the past until the present, Nov C. said that her daughters face difficulties with getting to work, and they always pay for hiring a taxi. To reduce the cost of transportation, Nov C. would like a $450 loan in order to buy a secondhand motorbike for her daughters to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand motorbike for her daughter to drive work.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa Emilia P. R. ella es trabajadora activa del colegio público “Santa Rita” Villa el Carmen desempeñándose como bibliotecaria del colegio tiene  diecisiete años de trabajar como docente, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  cuatro créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Emlia P. R. is an active employee at the Santa Rita Public School in Villa del Carmen. She is the school librarian but also has seventeen years of experience as a teacher. Rosa is currently married.

She has had four loans with CEPRODEL and each one has been used to buy construction materials so that she could expand and improve her house. Rosa has benefited greatly from the loans because they have helped improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for home improvements & expansion

loans.name: Jackline Wanjiru

texts.en:
Jackline is 30 years old and married to Samson Kariuki with whom they have two children. She has been in the mobile banking service business (M-pesa) for 4 years now with an income of 26,100 KES per month. She also sells mobile phone accessories in her shop as well. 

Jackline is taking her first loan in KADET and wants to use it to increase the cash flow for her mobile banking service shop. She hopes to expand her business and buy a plot of land to build rental houses in future and secure her family’s stable income.

loans.use: To increase the cash flow for her mobile banking service shop.

loans.name: Mujeres Vencedoras Unidas 2 Group

texts.en:
Marleny is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Vendedoras Unidas  2 (Unite winners women). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and 2 children. She says that her most difficult challenges is to work hard for her children.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to watch television.

Marleny is excited to be taking her 2nd loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 2 years, starting with her own money. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying beauty and cosmetics products. She will use the profits to finish her house. She wants to have an improve business.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because with this loan the borrowers can go forward with their business and her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally, her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics products for resale

loans.name: Kabembe Women's Group A-Mukono

texts.en: 56 Year old B. Rehema has been selling charcoal, chicken, firewood and movie DVD's for the past 21 years in Kabembe-Mukono. She says its her husband who motivated her into starting this business. Her hard working disposition, close friends say has gotten her this far. Most people around her area of operation use charcoal to cook. For that reason, over time she has obtained strong footing on the market for her business. Rehema is happily married with 4 kids. Weekly these businesses generate 250,000 shillings. With this loan, she says she is going to buy more bags of charcoal, firewood, and poultry.

loans.use: The purchase of more bags of charcoal, firewood, and poultry

loans.name: Rose Muthike

texts.en:
Rose Muthike, aged 46 years, operates a grocery shop in Kaloleni. She is married to Charles Mbithi and together they have four children: Nduku in college, Makau and Sammy in class eight, and Mbatha in class three. She was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Tala office.

Rose has been running this business for a period of 10 years and her monthly income is 7,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs). This loan of Kshs 40,000 is her third loan with KADET. Rose plans to use Kshs 25,000 to increase stock of sugarcane, tomatoes and bananas, and Kshs 15,000 to buy farm seedlings and fertilizers. If this loan boosts the business, she plans to expand the business and educate her children.

Rose's future dream is to expand her business and look for another source of income. She describes herself as a serious business lady.

loans.use: To increase stocks of tomatoes, sugarcane and bananas

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim O. has been spending her life cultivating crops. She has gained experience in the farming business since 2000. She typically earns an average revenue of $2.50 per day. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success.

Khim O. is married and has two school-aged children. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Recently, she and her family have been uncomfortable because their old house needs repair. Therefore, Khim O. would like a loan to purchase wood to repair the house. Khim O. and her young child appear in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase wood to repair her old house

loans.name: Mario Antolino

texts.es:
el sr. Mario Antolino Z. M. se dedica a la venta madera de pino, cedro, caoba, laurel y a la venta de materiales para la construcción  El Sr. Mario Antolino tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad,  siendo la venta de madera la de mayor fuente de ingresos que el tiene y para las temporadas de siembra de granos básicos, también aprovecha a sembrar para dejar una parte para el consumo y el resto la vende.
Con los ingresos que su negocio le deja cubre las necesidades de su familia.
Por los momentos no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para realizar algunas reparaciones de su vehículo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de repuestos para vehiculo y madera.
en su pick up transporta la madera y los materiales de construccion que el vende.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario Antolino Z. M. sells various types of wood, including pine, cedar, mahogany, and laurel, and he also sells other construction materials.  Mario Antolino has many years in the business, that is to say the sale of wood. It is his primary source of income and during the specific seasons he harvests basic grains. He takes some of his product for their own consumption and he sells the rest. 

The income form his business is enough to provide for his family's needs. 

Currently he doesn't have enough working capital to carry out some maintenance repairs to his car. 

The loan will be used to purchase spare parts for his car and to purchase wood. 

He transports his wood and construction materials destined for sale with his pickup truck.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair his pickup truck and to buy wood.

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuwa is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

He has operated a tailoring business for the past two years, selling to his neighbors in the community. Tsuwa faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to expand and sell wholesale items in the future.

With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase cloth for his tailoring business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for tailoring business.

loans.name: Elvies

texts.en:
One of the community partners of CCT*, Elvies T., dreams big for both his business and family. Elvies has been able to graduate from college. At 36, he is married to Irene, with whom he has three children. Together they live in Tanza, Cavite. To reach those big dreams, one of the steps Elvies took is to become a community partner of CCT.

Elvies runs a mini grocery, a dream for many small variety store owners. He also sells ready-to-wear clothes and school supplies based on the needs of his community. He has been running this business for five years now and is still counting. He manages to run the mini grocery alone, and monthly he earns an average of Php12,000.

To help him continue operation of his business, he would like to request a Php45,000 loan. With this amount he plans to buy a jeepney of his own with which he can deliver goods or products from one place to another. This will be of great help to his business, both for the mini grocery and the RTW business. The remainder of the loan money will be used to purchase more grocery items to add to his store.

Elvies constantly prays for a second floor to add to their house, because he wants the home to become better than it is at present. Also, it is his desire for his business to become productive and enable him to prepare a good future for his family. Of course, it is easily said than done, but for a person like Elvies who has the passion and determination to reach for his big dreams, nothing is impossible.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To re-stock inventory and a jeepney unit to be used for delivery of stock

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 42 años de edad y nació en la ciudad de Chichero, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hermosos hijos. Actualmente, Hilda vive en la ciudad donde nació y se encuentra muy feliz de vivir en su tierra natal, ella nos cuenta que la mayoría de los pobladores que viven en la ciudad se dedican a la elaboración, compra y venta de artesanía. Hilda no es la excepción y también se dedica a ese negocio, ella pertenece a la Asociación de Artesanos Kusicoyllor de Chinchero. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone su trabajo. 

Hilda en esta oportunidad requiere el microcrédito para comprar más artesanía o materiales para la fabricación de chompas de lana, bufandas y entre otras.
texts.en:
Hilda is 42 years of age and was born in the city of Chichero. She is married and has three beautiful children with her husband. Currently Hilda lives in the city of her birth and finds she is quite happy living in her native land. She tells us that the majority of the inhabitants of the city earn their living creating, buying and selling handicraft. Hilda is no exception and also dedicates herself to that business. She belongs to the Kusicoyllor Handcrafter's Association of Chinchero. She has been at her business for fifteen years and is doing very well thanks to the perseverance she shows in her work. 

Hilda on this occasion requires the loan for the purchase of more handcrafted goods or materials for making wool sweaters and scarves, among other items.

loans.use: to purchase more handcrafted goods or materials.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia has a business selling to the market assorted fresh fish caught by her fisherman husband. Working hard to improve their business, she is requesting a loan to purchase fishing hooks and nets which will help her husband catch more fish.

Amalia is 38 years old and has five children, the oldest 18 and the youngest only 2. Currently making improvements to their house, Amalia hopes to earn more and be able to complete the work soon.

loans.use: to purchase fishing hooks and nets

loans.name: Mrs. Mom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nineteen members who will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living.

 Mrs. Mom is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She was born in 1980. She is a mother of five children, four of whom are attending local public school, and the youngest one is a 3-year-old. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she can grow rice. She sells part of the rice and with the rest of the rice she supports her family, while her husband, Mr. Chek, is a fisherman and a cow middleman.

 Since her husband’s business is good, she wants to help him expand it. So Mrs. Mom is seeking a loan to add to her savings to buy more cows for resale.

loans.use: To buy more cows for resale.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: La señora Carmen tiene 35 años es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 9 años que están en el colegio, se dedica al negocio de venta de ceviche en el distrito de subtanjalla lugar que queda a 15 minutos de cuidad de Ica tiene 2 años trabajando de esta actividad, aprendió esta labor trabajando en una cevicheria de donde aprende los secretos de la cocina que después aplica en su negocio propio, este lo inicio por necesidad económica, genera un ingreso semanal de s/ 500 nuevos soles su sueño en el futuro es obtener un puesto en una buena ubicación para así incrementar las ventas de su negocio, y ello le genere mayores ingresos, el dinero lo invertirá en comprar platos, cubiertos ollas entre otras cosas para brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes, carmen esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que se esta brindando
texts.en: Carmen is 35 years old. She is a single mother with two children, aged 17 and 9, who are in school. Her business is selling ceviche in the district of Subtanjalla, a place which lies 15 minutes from the city of Ica. She has worked in this business for 2 years. She learned this profession by working in a ceviche restaurant, where she learned the secrets of the cuisine which she later applied in her own business. She started it out of economic necessity, and it generates a weekly income of 500 Peruvian new soles. Her dream for the future is to obtain a stand in a good location so she can increase the sales of her business, and it can generate more income for her. She will invest the funds in buying plates, tableware and pots, among other things, to provide better service to her customers. Carmen is very grateful for the support provided to her.

loans.use: to buy pots, plates and kitchen utensils, among other items.

loans.name: Ruth Elpidia

texts.es:
Como madre cabeza de hogar, Ruth Elpidia González Calle siempre se ha considerado una guerrera, pues debido a su falta de oportunidades laborales y su poca educación formal, se vio en la necesidad de crear su propio negocio, una tienda en la que vende productos de la canasta familiar ubicada en su vecindario en un barrio de Itagüí. 

Llegar a tener su casa propia y lograr mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia es el sueño de esta emprendedora y para lograrlo día a día trabaja largas jornadas, desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 10:00 de la noche, pero para ella este no es un sacrificio sino la manera de alcanzar sus sueños y de superarse. 

Debido a su gran vocación emprendedora, Ruth desea colocar en su tienda una venta de comidas rápidas, así logrará incrementar sus ingresos y debido a la gran acogida que ha tenido su negocio considera que diversificando logrará mejorar sus ventas, para lograrlo necesita de un préstamo para adecuar todo lo necesario para iniciar con esta nueva idea que será el inicio de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
As a mother and head of household, Ruth Elpidia González Calle has always considered herself a warrior.  Since she lacks work opportunities and has little formal education, she saw the need to create her own business, a store located in her neighborhood in Itagüí in which she sells basic household goods.

Having her own house and succeeding in improving her quality of life and that of her family is the dream of this entrepreneur. To achieve it, she works long hours day after day from 7 in the morning until 10 at night.  For her, this is not a sacrifice, but rather the way to reach her dreams and to better herself.

Due to her great entrepreneurial vocation, Ruth wants to place a fast food shop in her store.  That way, she will increase her earnings.  Due to the great reception her business has had, she thinks that by diversifying she will improve her sales.  To achieve this, she needs a loan to adapt everything needed to start with this new idea that will be the beginning of a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and a cart for the preparation of fast food

loans.name: Hippolyte

texts.fr: Né le 13 Août 1971 au Bénin, Hippolyte est marié à Sophie et a trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Hippolyte n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer les besoins de sa famille, Hippolyte mène comme activité la vente de produits congelés (poissons, ailerons, etc.) dans sa boutique sise dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Hippolyte vend divers produits (conserves de tomate, lait, œufs, etc.) dans la même boutique. Hippolyte achète ses produits dans les grandes centres de vente de produits congelés au Bénin. Hippolyte exerce cette activité depuis deux ans déjà. En vue de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Hippolyte sollicite pour la première fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Dans l'avenir, Hippolyte désire élargir son champ d’activité par l’ouverture d’une deuxième boutique.
texts.en: Born in Benin on August 13th, 1971, Hippolyte is married to Sophie and a father of three children who all attend school. The couple work together to meet their household’s needs. Hippolyte did not go to school. To cover his family’s expenses, he runs a business selling frozen products (fish, chicken wings, etc.) from his shop, located in his own neighborhood. Hippolyte rounds out his business by selling other various items (canned tomatoes, milk, eggs, etc.) from the same shop. He buys his stock at major frozen goods selling points in Benin. He has been working in this business for two years already. In order to better meet his customers’ demand, Hippolyte is requesting financial support from Alidé for the first time. In the future, he hopes to widen the scope of his business by opening a second shop.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish, chicken wings and canned goods

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon, 54, is a widow with four sons and one daughter – two are garment factory workers, one assists his mother in the farming business,  and other two are in school. The family lives in a village along National Road Number One, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Thon is farmer. She hopes to buy cows and oxen to raise so she will be able to earn extra income from selling them when they grow big enough. That’s why Thon is asking for a loan of $1,200 to make the purchase.

loans.use: purchase cows and oxen

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita is 58 years old and married with three children. She lives in Migpangi, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. For the past two years, Paulita has operated a retail shop where she sells a variety of products such as shampoo and toothpaste. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP. 

Paulita is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more products for her general store. She has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: to purchase products for her general store

loans.name: Savat

texts.en:
Savat, 64 years old, is a farmer with her husband. Their income is $2 per day. They have 4 children who are all working and have their own careers. They each make around $5 per day for their income. 

Every month, Savat spends $60 food and $10 on other expenses in the family. She would like to request a loan of $600 to help her son’s career. She will buy items as he needs. For her career as a farmer, she never wants to change because now she and her husband getting older. So, she and her husband will just keep doing farming when they have energy. Her children are responsible for all of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to help her son's career.

loans.name: Veth

texts.en: Veth, 60, is a grocery seller. She is a single mother with four children, two of whom are studying and two working for $3 per day each. Every month, she spends $70 on food, $12 on school fees and $10 for other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy more grocery goods to sell. Her career is going well and she can make a good income from it. She wishes to sell medicine as she wants to send her children to study pharmacy in university, so that she can open a pharmacy which also sells groceries at home.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Leyla Marina

texts.en: Leyla lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras, with her husband. For the past six years she has made a living by running a small convenience shop out of her home. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL to purchase merchandise for the store. Leyla is a returning client and has used previous loans to invest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, candy, soft drinks, beans, rice, eggs, lard, cooking oil, household cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells panties and cosmetics at Abura. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a teacher. She wishes to acquire a loan to buy more panties and cosmetics to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy more panties and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is married and her husband has a business selling clothes. He purchases clothes from different cities and sells to his community clients by putting them on his bicycle. He is a very dedicated and hardworking person and works very hard to put three meals on the table for his family. Naseem is a housewife who spends her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. She is the mother of six children but none of them could get an education due to financial constraints. One of Naseem’s sons is also involved in the clothes selling business and helps his father sell clothes. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy clothes in bulk quantity, which will allow him to offer more variety to his customers and increase his sales and profits. Naseem is confident that her husband’s business will grow further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Tania Martha

texts.es: La Señora Tania es una persona emprendedora con ganas de salir de adelante, ella es madre soltera con un pequeño hijo de 03 años,  se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite, huevos, leche en otros productos de primera necesidad para el hogar, además del alquiler de equipos musicales, el crédito otorgado es para invertirlo en comprar más variedad de estos productos con el fin del que el cliente tenga mejores opciones a la hora de comprar, y a la vez obtener mayores ingresos. Su gran meta es hacer crecer su negocio  y a la vez sueña con tener una casa propia. Ella está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado ya que cumplirá con sus objetivos trazados.
texts.en:
Tania is an enterprising person, eager to get ahead in life.  She is a single mother with a small three year-old son. She sells groceries such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, eggs, milk, and other basic household items, and also rents out music equipment.  

She will use the loan to buy a greater variety of these products, so that the customer has better choices at the time they buy, and she gets more income.

Her big goal is to make her business grow, and at the same time she dreams about having her own house. She is very thankful for the loan granted, as it will allow her to fulfill her plans.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Vina

texts.en:
Vina is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Vina has a food shop, or carenderia, that sells viands like caldereta (beef stew), afritada (chicken dish) & bihon (classic Filipino noodle dish). She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands for sale.
Vina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Vina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands (food items) for sale

loans.name: Jose Eliseo

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y dos hijos él se dedica desde hace muchos años a la siembra de granos básicos: maíz y frijoles, su padre le  enseño este oficio, por eso el no tiene un horario establecido de trabajo  de lunes a sábado.
El necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos como: herbicidas para las plagas y semilla para la siembra, abono para que sus cosechas sean abundantes y estén libres de plagas aunque sabe que es un trabajo arduo pero al final da buenas cosechas y más ingresos.
El sueño de José es sacar más producción de maíz y frijoles y vender una parte y lo demás dejarlo para los gastos de la casa para el sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and 2 children. He has worked for many years planting dry grains such as corn and beans. His father taught him this trade which is why he doesn't have a fixed work schedule from Monday to Saturday.

He needs the loan to buy consumables such as: herbicides for pests and seeds for sowing, manure so that his harvest is abundant and free of pests. Although he knows that it is a hard job he knows that eventually it gives good yields and more revenue.

José's dream is to increase his corn and bean yields so as to be able to sell part of the harvest and keep the rest for household consumption.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, manure and seeds for sowing.

loans.name: Ayudanos Señor 4 & 5 Group

texts.es:
Cita es una D. los miembros del Grupo Ayúdanos Señor 4 & 5 y está ubicado en L. ciudad turística D. L. Romana, en unas D. las comunidades D. más escasos recursos, rodeadas por campos D. Caña D. azúcar también llamados Batey, donD. L. mayoría D. los habitantes son inmigrantes haitianos, que vinieron a L. República Dominicana, con L. finalidad D. mejorar su calidad D. vida.

Cita esta muy emocionada por recibir su tercer préstamo con Esperanza Internacional, desD. que el programa llego a su comunidad, decidió formar parte del grupo con L. finalidad D. mejorar su negocio, el cual estaba falto D. capital. ElL. opera un puesto D. ventas D. frutas, verduras, vegetales y pollo, desD. su pequeña vivienda, L. cual comparte con su pareja, ya que parte D. su familia e hijos viven en Haití. 


Piensa invertir este préstamo en L. compra D. vegetales, varios quintales D. pollo y frutas. ElL. les venD. a sus vecinos, ya que por lo regular, los bayetes son comunidades aisladas y lejanas a L. ciudad. Cita desea ahorrar sus ganancias, ya que sus planes futuro es poder tener su propia casa y un mejor negocio.
texts.en: Cita is one of the members of the "Ayúdanos Señor 4 & 5" (Help Us Lord 4 & 5) Group, which is located in the tourist city of L. Romana, in one of the poorest communities, surrounded by sugar cane fields. These communities are also called batey and most of their inhabitants are Haitian immigrants who came to the Dominican Republic with the aim of improving their quality of life. Cita is very excited to be receiving her third loan from Esperanza Internacional. When the program arrived in her community, she decided to join the group with the aim of improving her business which was lacking capital. She runs a fruit, vegetable and chicken stall from her small home which she shares with her partner, as some of her family and children live in Haiti. Cita plans to invest this loan in buying vegetables, several 100lb lots of chicken and fruit. She sells her products to her neightors as 'bateyes' (sugar worker towns) are isolated communities which are far from the city. Cita would like to save her profits as her future plans are to own her own home and to have a better business.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, chicken, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Tinh

texts.en: Tinh is 34 years old and has 2 children. As a farmer, she is growing rice to support her family's food needs and also to sell a part to earn income. Besides, she raises 5 pigs for meat. Ms. Tinh joined our credit program in 2009. She has used loans to buy fertilizer and to expand her pig-raising. Currently, she wants to receive a loan of 8,736,000 VND to buy food for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for her pigs

loans.name: Ivan Antonio

texts.es:
el sr. Ivan Antonio esta casado y es padre de 3 hijos, Ivan se dedica al cultivo de cafe, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y nos manifestó que toda su vida se ha dedicado al trabajo de la tierra por qué fue lo que su padre le enseño.
Don Iván utilizara el credito para comprar un panel solar, el ha anhelado en toda su vida gozar de luz en su casa y manifiesta que al obtenerlo va a mejorar su estilo de vida y así sus hijos podran aprovechar mas las noches para estudiar.
texts.en:
Mr. Ivan Antonio is married and the father of three children. Ivan devotes himself to cultivating coffee and has eight years of experience in this line of business. He told us that his whole life he has dedicated himself to working the earth because that is what his parents taught him. 

Don Iván will use the loan to purchase a solar panel. He has been hoping his whole life to enjoy light in his home and states that, with it, his lifestyle will improve and his children will be able to make better use of the evenings for their studies.

loans.use: to purchase a solar panel.

loans.name: Pagam

texts.en: Pagam is 48 years old and lives with her husband, three kids, and one granddaughter in her own house in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business, two kids are employed, and the third is in school along with Pagam's granddaughter. Pagam started her secondhand garment retail business in 2009. Even though she is relatively new to the business, she is known for her excellent products. She even disinfects the products; however, her range of products offered is very limited due to financial problems. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy more used shoes.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has operated his electronics repair business in Olkalau town for the last four years.  He is 30 years old, married to Wangeci and they have one child who goes to school.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our existing clients and this will be his first loan. Stephen plans to use the loan amount to buy more chargers, along with radio and electronics spare parts, in order to sustain his business.

In the future, Stephen hopes to expand his business by selling electronics and phones, thereby increasing his income and improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy chargers, radio spare parts and electronics spare parts.

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es:
Constantina de 36 años de edad casado con Zenón de 36 años de edad, fruto de esta relación tienen 7 hijos.
Ellos viven en su casa propia que esta ubicado en el distrito de Pichari. Constantina es una persona que se dedica a cuidar a sus menores hijos ya que están en edad escolar, por lo que requieren asistencia de parte de su madre, 
Zenón su esposo trabaja cultivando cacao y otros productos, donde vieron juntos que su vecino Juan esta vendiendo un lote de terreno por lo que Constantina y Zenón decidieron comprarle dicho terreno pero les falta completar el capital, razón por el que Constantina recurre a MFP a solicitar un credito para completar capital.
Ahora Constantina esta agradecida y contenta por haber accedido al credito lo cual podrá realizar su anhelo deseado. Constantina en un futuro desea construir una vivienda donde podrá abrir una tienda de abarrotes. Este es su primer credito con MFP, por el que ella se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles complementara al capital suyo para la compra de un terreno (lote para vivienda)
texts.en:
Constantina is 36 years old and married to 36 year old Zenón.  Together they have seven children.

They live in a home of their own, located in the Pichari district.  Constantina is a person dedicated to caring for her school-aged children, but she also needs help from her mother.

Her husband Zenón farms cacao and other products.  They noticed that their neighbor, Juan, was selling a plot of land and Constantina and Zenón decided to buy it from him.  They don’t have enough capital, so Constantina approached MFP to request a loan.

Now Constantina is grateful and happy to have been granted the loan, which will allow her to fulfill her desire.  In the future she wants to build a house, from where she can also run a grocery store.  This will be her first loan through MFP and she is committed to making her payments on schedule.  The 1,500 PEN ($575) will complement her own capital for the land (for her house).

loans.use: to buy land on which to build a house.

loans.name: 1.1.10 Đông Hải Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huệ operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell. Huệ has been involved in this business for eight years.

Huệ is 42 years old, married, and has four children. She lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

She is the leader of a five-member group, the 10 Đông Hải solidarity group. 

In 2010, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Huệ has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Huệ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Huệ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fish and shrimp to resell.

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil is a 28-year-old, ambitious married Iraqi man with a shop that manufactures and supplies high quality PVC casement windows and doors.

The business has been steadily growing in the past seven years, and with numerous construction sites around the city, it is expected to keep growing and successfully generating revenue.

Adil took a loan from Relief International-Iraq for 3,000 USD to purchase a special machine for the factory used for melting/holding the frame elements together.

loans.use: to purchase a special machine for the window and door factory

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Tessie has a shop that sells jewelry like silver plated necklaces and bracelets. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of jewelry to sell.

Tessie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Tessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Abadahemuka 2 Group

texts.en: Helene is a group leader; aged 45 years.She is married with 6 children aged between 10 years. The group is called ABADAHEMUKA means “TRUSTED” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. She owns a suppermarket and has been running in a business for 4 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cakes, biscuits,juice and milk for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and to pay school fees of her children..

loans.use: to buy more cakes, biscuits,juice and milk for sale.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Mr S. has had his business for 13 years, where he makes doors, windows and other home accessories. He also installs what he fabricates, and employs others as well. His business has become a point of support for other families as well.

My clients prefer me to other businesses because of my motivation to do jobs of the highest quality at low cost. I would like my workshop to offer a more complete service to my customers, but my welding equipment has grown outdated with the years. I need a loan for $1,500 dollars to buy metallurgy tools and equipment(to cut metal), also a much larger welder. This will allow my business to grow and to employ more people.

Loan Use: To purchase metallurgy equipment and tools

El Sr. S. tiene 13 años con un taller donde fabrica puertas, ventanas y muchos otros accesorios para viviendas. Como también instala lo que fabrica, les da empleo a otras personas más. Con lo que ha sido una fuente de apoyo para otras familias. “Mis clientes me prefieren porque me esfuerzo por hacer trabajos de calidad y a un bajo costo. Quisiera que mi taller ofreciera un servicio más completo a mis clientes, pero mi equipo de soldar se ha acabado con el paso de los años. Necesito de un crédito de 1,500 dólares para comprar herramientas y equipo para cortar metal, así como una maquina para soldar más grande. Esto me permitirá hacer crecer mi negocio y dar empleo a más personas”

loans.use: Comprar equipo y herramienta para cortar metal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his refreshments business

loans.name: Maria Elida

texts.en:
Mrs Maria Elida is married and has five children. Her husband is a driver and his salary is insufficient to sustain the needs of their family. Maria used to work in a tortilla shop and thanks to the experience that she gained there she was able to start her own business in order to earn a better income. With the help of her 16 year old daughter, she has been able to create her own tortilla shop that they have run for 2 years in Saltillo, Coahuila, where they are originally from.

When they began they borrowed equipment for their work and little by little they have acquired the equipment necessary for making flour tortillas: a refrigerator, a grill, chairs, tables, etc. Now Maria needs a loan of $550 dollars that she will use to buy the supplies that she needs in order to produce larger orders of her products. The power to help this family is in your hands, don't doubt it, they will sincerely appreciate your assistance.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Elida es casada, tiene 5 hijos, su esposo es chofer y su salario es insuficiente para el sustento de su familia, anteriormente Maria trabajaba en una tortillería y gracias a la experiencia que adquirió pudo iniciar su propio negocio para poder obtener un mejor ingreso, con ayuda de su hija de 16 años ha podido hacer creer su tortillería que iniciaron hace 2 años en Saltillo, Coahuila de donde son originarios.

Cuando empezaron tenían equipo de trabajo prestado y poco a poco han adquirido la maquinaria necesaria para la elaboración de tortillas de harina, refrigerador, plancha, sillas, mesas, etc. Ahora Maria requiere de un préstamo por $550 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos que necesita para surtir grandes pedidos de sus productos. En tus manos esta el poder ayudar a esta familia, no lo dudes más, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en: Tatyana has operated a toy kiosk at the market in Melitopol, Ukraine for the past ten years. She began her business to support her family and aging parents. For Tatyana, the choice to focus her business in children’s toys was a simple one for the joy she receives in bringing happiness into children’s lives. Since she opened her business, her professional growth and development have consistently been supported through Nadiya Ukraines’s micro-finance program. A veteran client, Tatyana has repaid each loan faithfully and fully. Currently, Tatyana is seeking a loan for $500. With this loan, Tatyana plans to purchase additional inventory, maintaining the stable, consistent growth her business has enjoyed across the past decade.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Mrs. Eunice A. is 39 years old and is married with three children.  She hails from Benin City, Edo State, in Nigeria.  She sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs.  She has been in this business since 1992.  She needs a $250 loan to buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: to buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
After her husband passed away, Doña Concepción C. started to do laundry and ironing and on the week-ends prepared tamales and sold food in order to provide prosperity to her nine young children who are all now individuals seeking independence. Nevertheless, Doña Concepción is planning to establish a business in front of her house to be able to satisfy her personal needs as she never was covered by social security, today she has to pay the cost of her check-ups.

Therefore she is asking for a loan of $925, which she plans to repay in 6 months, so she can build and furnish a small food business and that way she will not have to leave her house. Doña Concepción wants to go on feeling useful not having to depend on any of her children and she feels she has the strength and will to start a new business. With your support Doña Concepción can make her dream come true.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Después del fallecimiento del esposo de Concepción C., y con nueve hijos pequeños, Concepción comenzó a trabajar lavando y planchando ropa, y los fines de semana hacía tamales y vendía comidas, así fue buscando la prosperidad de sus hijos quienes ahora son personas que buscan por su independencia, sin embargo Concepción, está buscando ubicar un negocio frente a su casita para poder mantener sus necesidades, puesto que nunca contó con seguro social, hoy tiene que pagar todos los gastos de sus chequeos.

Por lo tanto Acude a usted para solicitar un crédito de $925 para pagar en un plazo de 6 meses para poder construir y amueblar su pequeño localito de comidas para que ella no se tenga que desplazar a otro lugar. Concepción desea seguir sintiéndose útil, por lo tanto está buscando este negocio, y así no tener que depender de algún hijo, puesto que cree que las fuerzas y ganas las tiene para emprender un nuevo negocio. Con tu ayuda Concepción, podrá hacer su sueño realidad.

loans.use: To build and furnish a business to sell food.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar!* In a busy corner of the city, Mama Lunyunga runs a dawa (shop), where she sells food and soft drinks. She is a 33 year-old mother of three and the profits from her business supplement her husband Aron’s salary from his job at the head office of Tanzanian prisons to support their children, as well as Mary’s niece and nephew. Mama Lunyunga has already successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA and now requires another to expand her business further by increasing her stock. She thanks you very much for your support – ashante sana! *Hello from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania

About the microloan partner:

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.
