SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Mary would like to purchase additional stock for her food and soft drink store.

loans.name: Patrasia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam!  This is 38 year-old Patrasia C..  She is married with three children aged 9, 17, and 20.  In 2003, Patrasia established a café selling local food and drinks, and now requires a loan of $275 in order to purchase ingredients and stocks of soft drinks in bulk. 

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is.  A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches with the sky as a ceiling.  Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be.  The food is all local - rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana) - and all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and stocks of soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Nurhasanah

texts.en: Nurhasanah, 36 is married to N. and has 2 children. She sells clothing and household goods such as sheets, pyjamas, bulp, rice cooker, etc. on credit door-to-door around the villages. She makes $7 a day. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of $75 to add her business capital to increase her income to pay for her children's education. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Mrs. Im S., 39 years old, is a grocer who sells from her house in the Trapeng Beng Village in Kompong Cham Province, earning about $5 a day. Her husband, Mr. Kim Sokha, is a silversmith who also earns about $5 a day. She has three children, one of whom is a student, and the other two of pre-school age.
 
In order to increase her inventory of groceries, she requests a loan of $400. This loan will also further her children’s studies. She has proven to be a reliable client and promises to be punctual in her loan repayment.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of groceries for sale.

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
The “Cristo Rey” committee was formed by the union of various neighbours from the Las Garzas suburb of the town of San Antonio. From the start, confidence in and solidarity with the committee prevailed and today “Cristo Rey” is one of the best committees that operates in excellent order from the regional office in Villa Elisa

All the committee's members are mothers and workers, so all of them understand each other's situations. In the photograph are 14 or 15 members of the committee. All the members have their own activities, although some also have formal jobs and develop their enterprises in their spare time in order to increase their incomes as well as looking after their families. Among the activities they undertake we can note: sale of fast food, tailoring, sale of cleaning products, groceries, artesanal products etc.

The committee has a well-established organization and they are very responsible with their repayments. Their members have demonstrated their unity on several occasions, and they are already developing communal activities, such as solving any inconvenience at group level.

This committee wishes to ask for a new credit in order to invest in the purchase of merchandise for their sales and in this way ensure the continued increase of their income.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El Comité “Cristo Rey” se formó a partir de la unión de varias vecinas del barrio Las Garzas de la ciudad de San Antonio. Desde un principio, primó en el comité la confianza y la solidaridad y hasta el momento “Cristo Rey” es uno de los mejores comités que ha funcionado de manera excelente de la oficina regional de Villa Elisa.

Todas las integrantes del comité son madres y trabajadoras, por lo que todas se comprenden entre si la situación por la que están pasando. En la fotografía tomada, se encuentran 14 de las 15 integrantes del comité. Todas las integrantes tienen sus actividades propias, aunque algunas tienen trabajos formales, desarrollan sus emprendimientos en un tiempo extra para acrecentar sus ingresos, además de atender a sus familias. Entre las actividades que realizan podemos citar: venta de comidas rápidas, costureras, venta de productos de limpieza, despensas, artesanías, entre otras cosas.

El comité lleva una organización bien establecida y son muy responsables en sus pagos. Sus integrantes han demostrado su unidad en varias ocasiones, ya sea desarrollando actividades en forma conjunta, como solucionando cualquier inconveniente a nivel grupal.

Este comité desea solicitar un nuevo crédito para invertirlos en la compra de mercaderías para sus ventas y de este modo seguir incrementando sus ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase clay craftwork, textiles, fruits, clothes, cleaning products, ingredients for preparing food such as meat, food, flour, oil, noodles, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun C. is 32 years old. She has been running her small village grocery store since the year 2000. She earns about 1$ per day through this business. Her husband, Long Kolab, is 32 years old as well. He has a unique business as a potter, making jars, which has been handed down through the generations in his family. Since the end of the Khmer Rouge occupation of Cambodia in 1979 when he was only 2 years old he has been exposed to his family trade. He earns $3 per day. They have one child who is too small to attend school so he stays with his mother while she runs the store. With her loan, she hopes to purchase more groceries to increase her inventory. Right now she using her home to sell the goods from but would also like to apply her loan towards constructing a wooden stand by the roadside. Long Kolab is pictured here as his wife was unavailable to be photographed.

loans.use: To build a grocery store.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria C. is 34 years old, she is married to Mr. Victor Cardozo who is 39 years old and they have 5 school-aged children. They live in the city of San Estanislao, in the Monte Alto neighborhood, they have their own house. They have a grocery store in their home that is 5 years old, with a well-formed clientele, a good income, and excellent commercial and personal references. They need to purchase notions for their business, since there isn’t another store of this type in the area. They are hard working people and are always characterized for their enterprising spirit.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria C. tiene 34 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Victor Cardozo de 39 años de edad, tienen 5 hijos, en edad escolar. Viven en la ciudad de San Estanislao, en el barrio Monte Alto, tiene casa propia. Posee una despensa en su domicilio particular, con una antigüedad de 5 años, con clientela formada, buenos ingresos, y excelentes referencias comerciales y personales, El cliente necesita comprar artículos de mercerías para su negocio, ya que en la zona no existe otro negocio de ese rubro. Son personas muy trabajadores y siempre se caracterizaron por su espiritu emprendedor.

loans.use: to purchase milk, eggs, meat, vegetables, fruit, candy, etc.

loans.name: Livestock And Crafts Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoan Thi D. is 43 years old. She is currently living with her husband and two children. She and her husband weave flower baskets to sell to florists. Besides that she also raises livestock to supplement the family’s income. The family’s average income is about 80,000 VND per day. She likes the method of gradual loan repayment, so she always wished to participate in the Fund. She is requesting 4,256,000 VND to invest in raising livestock and weaving.
  • Her group includes:
  • Mrs. Lieu Thi H. is 48 years old. She is requesting 3,360,000 VND to invest in livestock.
  • Mrs. Thu Thi T. is 30 years old. She is requesting 3.360.000 VND to invest in raising livestock.
  • Mrs. Thuong Thi H. is 52 years old. She is requesting 3.360.000 VND to buy materials to make fans and brooms.
  • Mrs. Hoa Thi N. is 40 years old. She is requesting 3.360.000 VND to invest in livestock.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer.

    Cô Đỗ Thị Hoán (MS: 030001), năm nay 43 tuổi. Cô hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con. Cô và chồng thường ngày đan các giỏ hoa để bán cho các của hàng buôn hoa. Ngoài ra cô còn chăn nuôi để có thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Mức thu nhập bình quân của gia đình cô là80.000 VND/ngày. Cô rất thích với việc trả dần vốn vay, vì vậy cô luôn mong muốn được tham gia vay vốn chương trình. Cô vay 4.256.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi và đan lát.

  • Trong nhóm còn có:
  • Cô Hoàng Thị Liễu (MS: 030003), năm nay 48 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi.
  • Chị Trần Thị Thu (MS: 030004), năm nay 30 tuổi. Chị vay 3.360.000 VND đầu tư chăn nuôi.
  • Cô Hoàng Thị Thường (MS: 030005), năm nay 52 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND để mua nguyên liệu làm quạt, chổi.
  • Cô Nguyễn Thị Hoa (MS: 030007), năm nay 40 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi.
  • Nhóm đã đăng nhưng bi issue, ID cũ của nhóm là 53978).

loans.use: Livestock and weaving

loans.name: Beatriz Dina

texts.es:
Beatriz is a hard working woman. Since she was very young she has worked selling candy on the buses and public transportation in the city of Juliaca, where she has lived since she was 3 months old. She was born in Arequipa, but due to her parents' separation, she was taken to Juliaca. Beatriz is now 37 years old, and together with her husband, who works as a telephone operatory, she is searching for a better future. She is requesting this loan in order to prepare a space in her home for the sales of groceries and orange juice, and at the same time purchase a sewing machine which she will use to make dresses. Through these activities Beatriz will progress and will be able to be close to her children, so that she can care for and raise them.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Beatriz es una mujer luchadora, desde muy joven ha venido trabajando en la venta de caramelos en los buses y combis de la ciudad de Juliaca, ella vive allí desde los 3 meses, ya que nació en la ciudad de Arequipa, pero por la separación de sus padres, la llevaron a Juliaca. Ahora Beatriz tiene 37 años y junto a su esposo, quien trabaja en un locutorio telefónico, buscan un mejor porvenir.El motivo por el cual solicita este préstamo, es para implementar un espacio en su casa para la venta de abarrotes y jugo de naranja, a su vez comprar una máquina de tejer para la confección de prendas de vestir, con estas actividades Beatriz saldrá adelante y estará cerca de sus hijos, para su cuidado y orientación.

loans.use: To open a small store in her home, and to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A., 45, lives in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria with her husband and five children. Grace buys fish at wholesale and sells to retail fish vendors.

She is requesting a loan to buy one deep freezer so that she can freeze her fish, thereby preserving it. This will enhance her profit margin. Grace thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy one deep freezer for preserving fish

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, es una señora casada y tiene 5 hijos, ella es propietaria de un negocio que se dedica a las venta de plantas, abonos, entre otros productos para el jardín, su negocio esta úbicado en la ciudad de Eusebio Ayala.

Rosa comenta, que aparte de la venta de planta también tiene, un pequeño puesto de venta de chipas, en ambas activdades registra buena venta, porque esta ubicado en una zona dónde circulan gran cantidad de personas y esto facilita las ventas, además la zona es muy conocida por la produción de chipas denominado Barrero, que son de muy buena calidad, un aspecto que uno debe hacer frente es la gran cantidad de competencia en este rubro.

Con los prestamos que le otorgo la Fundación Paraguaya pudo comprar gran cantidad de plantas abonos, semillas y mazeta, entre otros articulos, otra parte del préstamo también lo invirtio en la compra de materia prima para la elavoración de chipas.

Sus principales clientes son los automovilistas y gente que pasan por la ciudad con destino a otros ciudades vecinas
texts.en:
Rose is a married and she has 5 children. She is the owner of a nursery where she sells plants, fertilizers, among other products for the garden, her business is located in the city of Eusebio Ayala.

Rose tells us that besides selling plants, she also has a small stand where she sells chipas (corn donuts), in both activities she has good sales, because she is is located in a area where there is a lot of traffic of people and this facilitates the sales, also the area called Barrero is known for the production of chipas, that are of very good quality. An aspect that she has to face is the big competition she has in order to sell her products.

With the loans that the Paraguayan Foundation granted her, she was able to buy a big quantity of plants, fertilizers, seeds and pots, among other products. Another part of the loan she used it to buy raw materials for the elaboration of the chipas.

Her main clients are the motorists and the people from nearby cities who drive past the city going to neighboring towns.


Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds, plants, fertelizers, etc.

loans.name: Gulbibi

texts.en:
Gulbibi is a mother of 3 adorable kids. she is very businesslike woman. She has more than one business. So she sells clothes at the market, fattens cattle and sells them and also grows wheat. She is a very unusual woman. 
She wants to borrow money to expand her business and also for buying more cattle and fertilizers for growing wheat.
Unfortunately Gulbibi wasn’t at the market when the photo was taken so we took a picture of her son who helps her out in her business.

loans.use: To purchase another calf and more fertilizers.

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en: Mrs. Chhan S. is a 49-year-old widow and she now lives in Lvea Sor Kandal village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces a problem because her field has infertile soil which makes her crop decline. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field. She would use the rest of the loan to buy rice seeds and fuel. She has four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the others are construction workers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, rice seeds and fuel.

loans.name: Folly

texts.fr:
Born in 1968 at Aného, Mr. Folly S. is married and is a father of five (05) children with three (3) others dependents. Painter by trade, the lack of work obliged him to give up to the barroom management.  
The galloping increase of his clientele outs him to look for a meaning working capital to respond to his demand. This, to increase his income and also to provide to his family's needs.
texts.en:
Born in 1968 at Aného, Mr. Folly S. is married and is a father of five (05) children with three (3) others dependents. Painter by trade, the lack of work obliged him to give up to the barroom management.  
The galloping increase of his clientele outs him to look for a meaning working capital to respond to his demand. This, to increase his income and also to provide to his family's needs.

loans.use: To sell beverages

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Née en 1970 Tsévié, Mme Akouvi F. est une grande commerçante de pagnes depuis plus de huit (08) ans. Douée et expérimentée dans ce commerce qu’elle exerce avec ses propres moyens financiers dont les revenus tirés n’arrivent pas à couvrir ses charges, Mme Akouvi sollicite un crédit pour augmenter son étalage de pagnes afin de pouvoir satisfaire tous ses clients et accroître considérablement son chiffres d’affaires et ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Tsévié, Madam Akouvi F. has been a major merchant of "pagnes" (colorful West African cloth) for over eight years. Talented and experienced as she is, doing commerce in this field using her own funds, she has not been able to derive the revenues to support her family. And so she is requesting this loan to expand her display of pagnes in order to satisfy all her customers and to grow her sales figures and profits considerably.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in pagnes

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn T. is 30 years old and has only one child. Her husband is a soldier in the Armed Forces of the Philippines and currently assigned in North Cotabato to combat government rebels who inflict trouble on the province. She is into farming and mangoes are her main crop. On a small parcel of land her husband inherited from his parents, they grow mangoes for the future of their children.

Jocelyn is asking a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI to buy fertilizer for her farm. The loan will also be used to pay for her tenants' labor in her mango plantation. Through this loan, she believes she will be able to have a better harvest.

Jocelyn also can take advantage of the insurance and training services as well as the credit assistance that CEVI provides to all its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of  fertilizer

loans.name: Jocilda

texts.en:
Jocilda N. is already 40 years old and still single. Choosing her current marital status was really her option. She lives with her parents, and she is spending a lot of time in her vending business with the help of her niece. Being single is her contentment in life.

Jocilda is a business woman with full of dreams and ambitions in life. She has been selling frozen products and fish for three year salready. She rolls those products from house to house in their village. Jocilda also wants to venture into operating a village store someday thus, she is doing her best to improve her current business to increase her daily income. This is also the reason why she wants to take out a loan amounting to PHP 7,000.

Jocilda adds, “not to lose hope for your value in God’s eyes never changes, no matter how many times you fail Him and how many mistakes you make ” This quotation has served as her guiding principle in life and brings her closer to God.

loans.use: business improvement

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru: фарогат клиентка  в Микроинвест уже четвёртый год. Вначале своей деятельности она имела маленький оборотный капитал, при помощи кредитов у неё увеличился оборот в несколько раз, и улучшилось семейное положение.Её ассортимент составляет нижнее бельё и колготки.Для увеличения ассортиментов колготок она подала следующую заявку.
texts.en:
Farogat has been a client of Microinvest for four years already. When she started her business activities, she had a small working capital; with the assistance of loans, she increased her turnover several times, and improved her family's well-being. Her stock assortment includes underwear and tights. To broaden her assortment of tights, she has put in a loan application.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: trade in undergarments and tights

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena B. is 50 years old. She is married and mother with seven children. Currently six of her children are working while the other is in senior high school. She lives at Moore in the central region of Ghana.

Abena is a trader who deals with assorted products like cooking utensils and plastic bowls, like lunch boxes etc. She mostly sells through hawking house to house. Abena has been trading for 14 months now with her humorous behavior. She has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her stand. She treks to Accra to purchase her stock of goods.

Recently Abena has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock. She requests a loan to buy more supply like cooking utensils etc. which is frequently demanded by her numerous customers. With the loan she believes she will make lots of profit to build a store to reduce the frequent of walking in the street to sell.

Abena would be grateful for your assistance. Abena belongs to a village bank called ‘Akukudrofo’ which means ‘Brave People’.

loans.use: Increase stock of inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To raise goats and sheep

loans.name: Hanit Nohelia

texts.es:
Noelia es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcas.
Noelia es soltera, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo, Noelia estudia computación, además vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, la mayoría de sus ventas son al crédito.
Noelia necesita un préstamo de 450 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de labiales, colonias.
Los sueños de Noelia son tener un negocio estable, tener una empresa de mototaxis y que su hijos tenga una buena educación.
texts.en:
Noelia is a member of the “Virgen de Cocharcas” Communal Bank. Noelia is single, 21 years old and has 1 son. Noelia studies information technology. In addition she sells cosmetics via catalog to friends and family, the majority of her sales are on credit. Computación needs a loan for 450 soles to invest in buying lipsticks and cologne. Noelia dreams of having a stable business, having a motortaxi business and that her children have a good education. .

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lipsticks and colognes.

loans.name: Saadalah

texts.en:
Saadalah is a 55 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their six children. Saadalah has owned a painting shop since 1970. He also sells all type of tools. He requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Saadalah has requested a loan. 
Saadalah is special in his work because he has competitive prices. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Saadalah will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur a eu la bonne idée de commencer en 2006 l'activité de ramassage des ordures , cette activité est très rentable pour lui car il détient le monopole dans son activité, ce qui lui permet de réaliser de grosses recettes sur ses services. De plus en en plus de ménages sollicite ses services, il veut alors agrandir son activité et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter du matériel pour le ramassage des ordures.
Il est marié et a 02 enfants, c’est avec le revenu de son activité qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This gentleman had the clever idea, in 2006, to begin collecting trash. This work is very profitable for him because he has a monopoly in his sector, which permits him to make a big profit on his service. More and more households are asking for his service, so he wants to expand his business and is asking WAGES for a loan to buy material to use for trash collection.

He is married and has 2 children. He uses the income from his business to support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of material for trash collection

loans.name: Benkadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi 6 est constitué de 2 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans, 3 enfants et  vivant  dans des familles polygames à Massoukou,  un des villages de la commune rurale de Tingolé, sous préfecture de Fana, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles viennent de commencer leur collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités hivernales. Elles font exclusivement la culture d’arachide qui reste la principale culture de la zone. 
Par rapport à l’utilisation de ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, des semences, des intrants, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 2  hectares.
La production sera vendue au niveau des marchés de Marka-Coungo, Fana et Tingolé après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes venant généralement des grandes villes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000FCFA par campagne.
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi 6 ambitionnent avoir des montants à hauteur de souhait.
texts.en:
Benkadi 6 is made up of two married women with an average age of 27 and 3 children, living in polygamous families in Massoukou, a village belonging to the rural community of Tingolé, Sous-préfecture of Fana, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They have just begun to work with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to work at rainy-season businesses. They grow peanuts exclusively, which is still the principal crop in this area.

They expect to use this loan to buy seeds, agricultural intrants, and small equipment and to pay the costs of weeding and plowing so as to maintain 2 hectares.

Their produce will be sold in the markets of Marka-Coungo, Fana and Tingolé after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women coming generally from the big towns. They expect to make an average profit of 20,000 F CFA for the growing season. Their ambition is to earn as much as their hearts desire.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and odds and ends

loans.name: Aboubakar

texts.fr: Aboubakar A. est un jeune homme de 28 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. il est tailleur à Adeta. Aboubakar exerce c métier depuis 4 ans. Il souhaite avec ce crédit acheter une machine à coudre et aussi tenir le commerce des tissus afin d’assister les clients dans le choix de tissus à confectionner.
texts.en:
Aboubakar A. is a young man, 28 years old, married, and the father of one child. He is a tailor in Adeta. He has been working at this trade for four years. He wishes to use this loan to buy a sewing machine and also to do business in fabrics in order to assist customers with a choice of fabrics for making clothing.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and cloth to sell

loans.name: Sarafina

texts.en:
Sarafina is a member of the Ikweta North borrower group,she is 42 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children.Her children are aged 12,16,8 and 22 years.

Sarafina started her own business selling local beer 2 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximate 150,000 Tsh.

This is Sarafina first loan from BRAC.she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities like wheat,sugar for her business.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Sarafina hopes to save more money ,pay school fees,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more wheat,sugar,

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes F. is from the town of Baliangao. He is 55 years old. Lourdes is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising goats for sale. Lourdes has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional goat. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Lourdes from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional goat for raising

loans.name: Michael Gichuki

texts.en: Michael is 34 years old and married to Esther who is a businesswoman. They have one child who is five years old. Michael was introduced to KADET by existing group members. He has no loan from other micro-finance institutions. He has been in the vehicle maintenance and auto spares business for six years. His customers are business people dealing with auto parts and public service vehicle owners who purchase parts for their vehicles. Michael has applied for a loan which he will use to import new and second hand spare parts. With the extra profits, he intends to expand his business fully, stop selling secondhand parts and rely solely on new parts. Michael believes he is hardworking, determined, and focused and thus wants to accomplish his future hopes and dreams which includes starting a business selling motor vehicles. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To import new and used auto spare parts from Uganda

loans.name: Rosa's Group

texts.en:
Rosa, a fifty–year old divorced mother of four children, is the leader. Her eldest son, 31, lives in another town and her daughter, 29, is married and lives separately as well. Another son, 26, is married and lives with his family. Only her youngest son, 20, is still single and lives with her. To earn her daily bread, Rosa occupies herself with cattle breeding. She manages to make some extra money from selling milk and also works part time as a guard. From time to time she produces cottage cheese and sour cream and also sells it to local villagers. Rosa brought up her children doing this same job, and continues to work hard even though her children are now able to support themselves. Rosa’s total earnings amount to 70 US dollars. It is the way of life she has gotten used to, including receiving enjoyment from breeding cattle. Now, Rosa needs a loan to buy a calf for breeding. She is already awaiting grandchildren and making arrangements to marry her youngest son.

Rosa’s partners are: Erkinbek, Elmira and Venera. Erkinbek, 55, is a father of five children. All his children are grown-up and earn their living themselves. He works as a security guard at a car station and raises livestock. Erkinbek wants to increase the total population of his cattle and hopes that by obtaining a loan he will be able to buy several sheep.

Elmira, 54, has mothered four children. She is a widow. To make a living she is engaged in poultry farming. Her son, 29, works as a car maintainer and another son does odd jobs at a brick producing factory. Her daughter has recently gotten married. Her youngest son is a senior at high school. Elmira needs a loan to prepare her daughter’s dowry.

Venera, 34, is married. She has two children. Her husband works as a shepherd. Venera is a housewife. She manages to earn a little money selling milk. Their total monthly income is around $105. Venera wants to obtain a loan to buy another cow.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a calf for breeding and then to increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 44 years old and married with six children. She sells groceries at the front of her house in Benin City, Edo state. She is a hardworking woman. She hopes for the loan amount of 40,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more groceries to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: José Darvin

texts.es: Don José T. tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero de oficios Tejedor,  “Elaboración de cortes típicos”, habita junto  con su familia, ella y su familia se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un pequeño Taller, llevan  tiempo ya  de Tejer   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  Chibatz del  Cantón Xolsacmalja, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
José T. is 24 and single. He is a weaver, and he makes typical skirts. He lives with his family. He and his family do the same work, and they have a small shop. They have been making skirts for some time. Their home is locted in the Paraje Chorajche in the Cantón Pasajoc, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Current customer demand is growing, but the economic condition in which he finds himself is not sufficient to increase his capital. That is why he came to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. He will buy raw material to be able to increase his sales. He is also hoping to get his family ahead and to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make typical skirts

loans.name: Cordelina

texts.en:
Cordelina B., 47, from the village of Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City, is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Cordelina owns and operates a specialized retail business whose main income comes from buying and selling firewood in the local community. Cordelina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Cordelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, she is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Erika Del Carmen

texts.es: La joven Ericka García  trabaja en una librería desde hace un año, y los fines de semana hace sopa, vigoron, y una variedad de alimentos los domingos  para ganar un poco mas, vive juntos con sus padres en el barrio la Esperanza, tiene 19 años de edad, soltera y con muchos deseos de salir a delante. Uno de sus metas es poder seguir estudiando. Con este financiamiento es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra,  arena, hierro, cemento para hacer un muro  en frente de la casa, para dar una mejor seguridad, por que muchas veces las pandillas del barrio hacen pleitos en la calle y da mucho miedo y con este muro pondrá una barrera a la delincuencia, a si como mejor presentación, el cual esta contenta por alcanzar estos logros y poder ayudar a sus padres mientras este con ellos ya que son mayores de edad.
texts.en:
Young Ericka G. has worked in a bookstore for a year. On the weekends, she makes soup, pork salad, and a variety of foods to sell in order to earn a little more. She lives with her parents in the Esperanza neighborhood. She is 19 years old, single, and has a strong desire to get ahead. One of her goals is to be able to continue her studies. She will use this financing to invest in the purchase of construction materials such as: stone, sand, iron and cement to make a wall in front of her house for greater security, because many times the gangs in the neighborhood have fights in the street, which is very frightening. With this wall she will be able to put a barrier between these activities and her house, and also improve its appearance. She is very pleased to be able to reach for this goal, and to be able to help her parent while she is with them, since they are older.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy stone, cement, iron to make a wall in front for greater security

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is married and has two children named Clifford and Joan. He was introduced to KADET through existing clients, is now on his third loan and has had no other loans from other MFIs. 

With the loan, Tom intends to increase his stock of cereals and vegetables. Tom has has a food kiosk for two years.

Tom's business is located in a busy place and has many customers. His main customers are casual laborers who are employed near the client's business.

With the extra profits, the client will start selling cereals wholesale as he hopes to start another food kiosk in another location to maximize profits.

Tom believes that by being hardworking, he will provide for his family and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Increase stock of cereals and vegetables

loans.name: Promise Group

texts.en:
Grace, age 46, is a baker. She is the one standing in the middle of the group photograph, wearing the yellow top. She has been baking and selling bread in bulk for four years now and has been able to meet the demand of her customers despite having faced numerous challenges. She supplies her wares in the market center to her customers and also offers bulk delivery to customers who require it.

Her only problem now has to do with procuring adequate funds to buy raw materials now that prices are going up. She requests this loan in order to buy stock baking materials like margarine, sugar, firewood, and flour. She is eager to continue to increase profit through her business throughout the extended festive Christmas season.

With the loan, she can continue to provide for her children, especially in terms of ensuring their education. She is the divorced mother of five children, two of whom have graduated from the senior high school: the younger ones are still in school.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Promise.' Most of the members of this group are petty traders and foods vendors. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan, and they support each other in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, and firewood

loans.name: Mayra Petrona

texts.es:
la sra. Mayra Petrona V. tiene 45 años de edad, vive en la colonia Reparto Arriba de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, Mayra se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para empezar a producir sus tortillas de las cuales la primera produccion esta lista a las 6:00am, para poder repartirlas a sus clientes, la segunda produccion es para la hora del medio dia.
sus clientes le estan haciendo pedidos mayores todos los dias y no se da abasto para cumplir con todas las exigencias que tiene, es por tal razon que esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas materiales para la fabricacion de las tortillas y asi tener una mayor produccion.
las ganancias las necesita para el sustento de su familia y su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mayra Petrona V. is 45 years old and lives in the Reparto Arriba neighborhood of Tegucigalpa. Mayra’s job is make and sell tortillas. She gets up at 4:00 a.m. to begin making tortillas, the first of which are ready at 6:00 a.m., which she then delivers to her customers. The second batch is ready around noon. Every day her customers are ordering more tortillas and she can’t keep up with all of their demands. Because of this, she is applying for this loan to buy more tortilla-making materials so she can produce more. She needs her income to maintain her home and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: firewood, corn flour, water, matches--materials to make tortillas

loans.name: Sabitiou

texts.fr: T. Sabitiou est née le 14 juin 1974 à Takon dans le département de l’Ouémé au BENIN. Sabitiou vit à Gankpodo, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du BENIN depuis 8 ans. Mariée à AGBANGLA Djamiou, Sabitiou est mère de 2 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Le couple vit avec les enfants et assure ensemble les besoins de la famille. Pour apporter sa part contributive, Sabitiou  exerce comme activité la vente de divers produits vivriers (légumes, jus de fruits, boissons en canettes et en plastiques, les épices écrasés etc.). C’est à Lomé, capitale économique du TOGO, pays limitrophe du BENIN que Sabitiou s’approvisionne. Sabitiou effectue la vente de ses produits à Ganhi, un marché de Cotonou. Sabitiou n’a pas été à l’école mais exerce son activité depuis 10 ans. Sabitiou a déjà obtenu une fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Dans le souci de diversifier ses produits et d’étendre son activité, Sabitiou désire bénéficier d’un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Sabitiou T. was born June 14, 1974 in Takon, in the Ouémé department of Benin. For the past eight years, she has been living in Gankpodo, a neighbourhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Djamiou AGBANGLA, Sabitiou is mother of two children who are all in school. The couple lives together with their children and share in dealing with household expenses. To contribute her share, Sabitiou sells a variety of food products (vegetables, fruit juice, canned and bottled soft drinks, ground spices, etc.). She gets her supplies from Lomé, the economic capital of Togo, a country adjacent to Benin. She sells her products at the Ganhi market of Cotonou. Sabitiou has not attended school but has been doing business for ten years. She was already granted one loan from ALIDé, which was fully reimbursed. She is requesting a second loan so that she can diversify her offerings and expand her activity.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Diversify her products (vegetables, fruit juice, canned and bottled soft drinks, etc.)

loans.name: Chultem

texts.en:
Chultem is 34 years old and she lives with her husband and three children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. They live together in an apartment. Chultem operates her business with her husband. Two of her children go to secondary school and the youngest child goes to kindergarten. 

Chultem and her husband support their family with the profits from their business. They started their meat selling business with 500,000 tugrugs (~ $351 US) of working capital in 2007. Currently, their working capital is 800,000 tugrugs (~ $562 US). Chultem has been planning to expand her business and to get a permanent job. She says, “I would like to expand my business and increase my working capital. If the working capital will increase, the profit will increase too.” She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan to purchase a large amount of meat at wholesale prices for her meat selling business.

loans.use: To purchase more meat for her butcher shop

loans.name: Lenie's Group

texts.en:
Lenie S. is from Biray, Molicay, Ozamiz City. She is 34 years old and is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Lenie is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling vegetables like squash, eggplant, cabbage, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Lenie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. Lenie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Ros M. is married and resides with her children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has six children.

M. is engaged in a business producing sacks (usually of strong material), earning an income of 2 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a construction worker, earning an income of 10 USD per day. He has been with his business since 2000. Their standard of living has been improved since they have had these businesses.

M. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to build rental rooms for garment factory workers. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To build rental rooms for workers at the factory

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Aside from Milagros F.’s sari-sari (variety) store financed by the loan she received from ASHI, she also has a hog-fattening business which is her way of saving her profits to support the needs of her family, especially for her child’s education until college.

Hogs she fattens will be sold after four months, either alive or slaughtered, to people in their village or to the market vendors in the public market. Milagros really enjoys her productive role managing two business because both are financially enhancing her capacity to support their needs in addition to her husband’s small income as a hired laborer.

Milagros is hoping to increase the volume and variety of her store inventory to be able to increase her sales as well as her profits. For this reason, she is requesting a loan that is larger than the ones she received previously through ASHI.

Once her store can offer more grocery items and immediate-use commodities to her costumers, Milagros is pretty sure that someday her business would become stable and profitable. By then her life, along with that of her husband and child, will be improved and happier.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items and goods to sell

loans.name: Matea

texts.en:
Matea P. is from the village of Westfield, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 58 years old. Matea is widowed and has three adult children. To make a living, Matea owns & operates a specialized retail store selling alcoholic beverages including beer & wine in the local community. Matea has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Matea joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Matea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Matea is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Matea from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her house. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Westfield, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Orienta

loans.name: Jenely

texts.en:
Jenely O. is a popular business man 38 years old. He a father of six children of whom three are in school and he has five additional dependents who are orphans.

He deals with a retail shop business and he has been in this business for over ten years.

He will use his loan to purchase more retail items such as soap, salt, rice, tooth paste, sugar, and so forth, to sell and meet his customers’ demand. His future hope is to extend his market.

loans.use: To purchase more retail items to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn R., 56, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married and blessed with a child, she makes sure that she helps her husband earn enough so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for quite some time now.

Evelyn has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 27,000 loan. This amount will be used as added capital for her expanding business, enabling her to buy groceries needed to replenish and maintain her variety store.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her child’s education.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her variety store

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Mrs. Kan K., 44, has rented a place outside the market where she sells a variety of fruits for daily income. She has a life partner in her husband, who appears in the photo, and who assists her in selling fruit. He also plants a few vegetables on a plot near their house for the propose of eating and selling. This older couple has a young child who is a student in the high school.

Although her enterprise is profitable, to generate a larger daily income Kan K. needs to sustain her business growth but lacks the capital to do so. She would therefore like a loan to order different kinds of fruit to sell.

loans.use: To order different kinds of fruit to sell

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is a single mother of four children and all her children go school. She also takes care of additional family members. She owns a stall in Kalerwe market selling bananas. She works on the outskirts of Kampala. She buys bananas from Masaka District in central eastern Uganda and so uses public transport to and from those villages. 

Barbara wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas.  She has been in this business for ten years. She pays daily market dues of 1000/=. Barbara works six days a week.  Her business challenges include transportation and defaulters. She is aspiring of owning a delivery van.   

Barbara joined MCDT because she wanted additional capital for her business. She owns a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water at home. Her monthly expenses includes food,  school fees, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel C. is from the village of Medina, Misamis  Oriental. She is 38 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Raquel runs a sari-sari (variety) shop selling both food and daily use products. Raquel has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Raquel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raquel is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Raquel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Esterlita's Group

texts.en:
Esterlita F. is from the village of Dapaon. She is 50 years old. Esterlita is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. 

Esterlita is married. To make a living, Esterlita owns & operates a canteen business venture. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over 19 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Esterlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Esterlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy products to sell

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón B. Rodríguez es un señor de 34 años de edad  quien vive con su esposa y  5 hijos  en una de Reserva habitada por uno de los grupos  Indígenas más importantes de Costa Rica los  “Guaimí”. Está Ubicada en San Vito de Coto Brus una zona caracterizada por su elevada Ubicación y por estar a solamente una hora del Parque Internacional La  Amistad. Sus principales actividades económicas son la Agricultura, la artesanía y el Turismo  el cual ha aumentando en los últimos años.

Don Ramón posee una pequeña Finca en la cual ha sembrado frijoles toda su vida. Por lo que la producción de frijoles ha sido siempre su principal actividad económica, sin embargo la falta de dinero le ha imposibilitado mejorar su negocio.
Es por eso que el necesita  un préstamo de ¢200.000 (doscientos  mil colones) para comprar semilla de Frijol y pagar a los peones que trabajaran para tener la mejor cosecha este año. Asegura que está muy alegre ya que gracias a este préstamo podrá sacarle provecho a su terreno.


Don Ramón  es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Ku Kwata, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y asegura que espera seguir participando más activamente con esta organización.
texts.en:
Ramón B. Rodríguez is a 34 year old gentleman who lives with his wife and five children on a reserve inhabited by one of the largest indigenous groups in Costa Rica known as the Guaymí. The reserve is located in San Vito de Coto Brus, an area known for its elevation and being located an hour away from La Amistad International Park. The main business activities are agriculture and handicrafts. Tourism has increased within the last few years.

Don Ramón has a small farm on which he has planted beans for most of his life. Since growing beans is his main business activity, the lack of money has prevented him from improving his business. For this reason, he needs a loan of 200,000 CRC to buy seeds for planting beans and to hire workers so that he can produce his best crop this year. Ramón says he is pleased and expresses his thanks for the loan since he will be able to take advantage of his land.

Don Ramón is a member of Ku Kwata Communal Credit Enterprise, one of the 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he says that he hopes to continue participating more actively with this organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting beans & pay for labor

loans.name: Cecilia Jeremias

texts.pt:
Cecília jeremias T. conseguiu comprar todo material que esteve previsto no empréstimo com a Hluvuku e foi para o destino acordado com a instituição.
	
Foi possível pagar o empréstimo em menos tempo do que esteve previsto, isto devido ao aumento da sua receita que chegou a superar as expectativas, motivando assim a duplicar o pagamento do seu calendário de pagamento.

Não verificou nenhuma mudança em sua vida, a não ser o melhoramento do seu negócio.

 Com o presente empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt pretende comprar mercadoria (mesas, cadeiras, camas, mesinha de cabeceira e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu stock.

No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para construir um estabelecimento comercial perto da sua casa, como forma de diminuir a distância que percorre ate ao atual local de trabalho.
texts.en:
Cecília Jeremias T. managed to buy all the materials listed on her Hluvuku loan, and it was used as agreed with the institution. It was possible for her to pay off the loan ahead of time, owing to an increase in income which surpassed her expectations, motivating her to make extra payments and pay off the loan early. She did not have any changes in her life other than the improvement of her business. With the current loan of 25,000 meticais, she intends to buy merchandise (tables, chairs, beds, bedside tables and others) to increase her inventory. In the future she would like to ask for more loans to build a commercial establishment near her house, as a way to diminish the distance that she travels to her current place of business.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (tables, chairs, beds, bedside tables and other items)

loans.name: Leyda Edith

texts.es:
Leyda de 28 años, tiene un taller de confección y costura en la sala de su casa. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral. Es madre soltera con una hija de 5 años y vive en una casa de caña. 

Empezó cociendo ropa por la necesidad de mantener a su hija poco a poco con la insistencia de la mama pudo comprar unas maquinas de coser y ubicar el taller de confección en la sala de su casa. Su horario de trabajo es de 07h00am hasta las 19h00pm. Hace blusas, conjuntos de ropa, pantalones.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una maquina de coser y telas. En el futuro quiere tener mas grande su negocio y tener estabilidad económica para ella y su hija.
texts.en:
Leyda, age 28 years, has a workshop of sewing and dressmaking in a room of her house. She lives in a suburb called Perimeter. She is a single mother with a daughter of 5 years and lives in a house made of cane. She began making clothes due to the need to support her daughter. Little by little, with the assistance of her mother she was able buy a sewing machine and arrange the sewing workshop in the room of her house. Her working hours are from 7AM to 7PM. She makes blouses, suits, and pants. With the loan she wants to buy a sewing machine and fabric. In the future she wants to grow her business and to have economic stability for her and her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena U. R. tiene su negocio de venta de ropa y calzado. Tiene más de 10 años en este tipo de actividad, es madre de familia de tres hijos, ella trabaja junto con su esposo donde ha venido sacando a delante el negocio.
Ellos trabajan de 7 de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde en el mercado oriental de Managua, el préstamo solicitado es para la compra de ropa y calzado para su negocio.
Es su primer préstamo con la institución .
texts.en:
Magdalena U. R. has a business selling clothes and footwear.  She has been doing this type of work for over ten years.  She has three children.  

She works with her husband, and they have been getting the business ahead.  They work at the Mercado Oriental in Managua from seven in the morning until five in the afternoon. 

The requested loan is to buy clothes and footwear for her business.  This is her first loan with the institution.

loans.use: To buy clothes and footwear

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda Y. is from the village of Villa Nueva. She is 56 years old. Erlinda is single. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 40000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 34 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cartons of fish

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 50 years old, married to Susan and he supports three members of his family. He is doing mixed farming (animal and farm) and this has been his business for a period of 4 years with an income of 14,000 KES a month.

He has never been a member of an MFI and this is his first loan with KADET.  He intends to use this loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and manure and animal feeds such as maize jam, dairy meal and deworming medication for the animals.

He hopes to expand his business and become a leading local farmer and own a milk processing plant.

loans.use: To buy animal feed, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Hello from Faustin in Rwanda!  Faustin is 45 years old and married with seven children between the ages 10 and 27. He also has one adopted orphan. This is the first loan he has requested from Kiva lenders.  He has 15 years of experience as a butcher and his shop is open from 6 am until 8 pm.   Faustin runs a butcher business where he sells beef to the local people. He employs four people to help him run the business. A kilogram of beef costs 1800 Rwandan Francs ($3), and Faustin sells about 350 kilograms a day.

Faustin has requested a loan of 600,000 Rwandan Francs to be repaid in 10 months.  He wants to buy two cows to slaughter during the upcoming Christmas festivals.

loans.use: To buy two cows to slaughter during Christmas festivals

loans.name: Ahlidin

texts.en:
M. Ahlidin is a 51-year-old cattleman who is married with two children. He has been involved in this business since he was a young man. He purchases cattle in the local market and then he breeds and sells them. The cattle are kept in the house and it takes a lot of effort to care for them. Every day Ahlidin gets up early in the morning to feed his animals, and all day until late at night he is busy looking after the cattle. Ahlidin says that he works with only one aim in mind - to provide his children with proper education. Now, Ahlidin would like to expand his business and purchase more cows. For this purpose, he has applied for $2000 USD and with your help he hopes to reach his aim. 
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Julia's Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de San Juan del Paraná  surgió por contacto de una de las señoras con la fundación,  el grupo se encuentra en el 12º ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2005  con pagos excelentes, tienen un ahorro de 7.928.680  Gs. 
 La Directora General es la Sra. Julia F. su marido trabaja en la chacra y también ayuda en el kiosko que es la actividad .
Los créditos que ella recibe  dentro del comité lo invierte en la compra de mercaderías (Bebidas como gaseosa, vinos, gaseosas, y otros)  para surtir el kiosko , lo cual es muy importante  para ella y su familia , ya que de esta manera consiguen mejores precios y cantidad. De las  ganancias que le genera la venta ella  paga la cuota de su comité y el resto es un ingreso importante para su familia.
 
Todas las señoras del grupo también  realizan actividades productivas como ser :  venta de ropas,  venta de  verduras, venta de huevos, venta de comidas , modista  etc.
texts.en:
This group from San Juan del Paraná started through contact of one of the women with the Foundation. The group is now in its 12th loan cycle, working with the Foundation since 2005, with excellent payment history and a savings of 7.928.680 Gs.

The General Director of the group is Mrs. Julia F.. Her husband works on the farm and also helps in the kiosk which is her business.

The loans that she receives from the committee will be invested in purchasing merchandise (beverages such as soda pop, wine, and more) in order to stock her kiosk, which is very important for her and her family, as in this way they can get better prices and quantity. From the earnings that are generated from sales she makes the loan payment to her committee and the rest is important income for the family.

All the women of the group also are actively employed: selling clothes, selling vegetables, selling eggs, selling food, seamstress, etc.

loans.use: Buy beverages such as wine, beer, soda pop, and more.

loans.name: Chy

texts.en: Chy S., age 35, is married to Hang Va, age 37, and they have been living in Kompong Cham province. Chy S. has five children, four of whom are single, while the other one is married. Chy S. has two daughters who work as sewing workers at the garment industry, and has a formal salary monthly. Chy S.’s husband has been earning a living for years by climbing the palm trees behind his house. Palm-tree-climbing, as an occupation, is very common for poor people who live in the community. Chy S. will use her loan to assist her husband’s business toward buying ladders and containers for collecting palm juice.

loans.use: To buy ladders and containers for collecting palm juice.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, beans, flour, sugar, milk etc.

loans.name: Progress Ii Group

texts.en:
Umaru J. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Umaru was born in Sokuralla village near Kabala town. He is 35 years of age. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has three children, two of whom attend primary school. 

Umaru has been a motor-bike taxi driver for five years. This is the first loan that Umaru and his group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Umaru will use his share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy goats and sheep in order to diversify his business.

loans.use: Buy goats and sheep in order to diversify his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fabrics for sale

loans.name: Yelba Argentina

texts.es: La señora Yelba Argentina, tiene la edad de 26 años , habita en el municipio de la Concepción , junto a su esposo el cual labora como comerciante de frutas y verduras para poder llevar el alimento de sus dos  hijos , ellos son de familia muy humildes ; doña Yelba  desde hace seis años se dedica al cultivo de pitahaya ya que su mamá desde pequeña le enseño el trabajo agrícola , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es  la falta de ingreso para poder comprar los fertilizantes necesarios para que este cultivo llegue a su ciclo que cosecha y pueda dar el color rojo de la pitahaya en forma agradable para el cliente y su tamaño . El préstamo lo quiere para la comprar fertilizantes e insumos .
texts.en: Mrs. Yelba Argentina, is 26 years ld and she lives in the municipality of La Concepcion. She lives with her husband who works as a fruits and vegetables merchant in order to feed their two children. They are a very humble family. Yelba has been involved in the cultivation of prickly pears for the past six years. her mother taught her the business of agriculture since she was very young. Her greatest difficulty is the lack of income to be able to purchase the necessary fertilizers so that the plantation will reach the harvest cycle and to give the prickly pears their red color and size to make them attractive to the customer. She requires the loan to purchase fertilizers and other agricultural products.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other agricultural products

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a food vendor in Trinidad, Bohol. She makes different kinds of rice cakes and pansit (noodles). She started this business a year ago. Editha works hard to build up her business. She said she has to earn more because both of her kids now go to school.

Editha requested a loan to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil and other ingredients. She says this loan will help improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil and other ingredients

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena  is 35 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is married and has two children that are 14 and 3. She was able to attend school up to 11th grade herself, and her oldest is attending school. Her husband has his own business. 

Helena has been selling coal in her community for 5 years. She sells the coal in large sacks and likes talking to her customers but says it's difficult to get the sacks back from them which results in more expenses. 

Helena requested a loan to purchase more coal. In the future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more coal

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del  Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno.  Tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Cuenta con grado de instrucción  educación técnica.
La señora  se dedica  a la venta de prendas de vestir, venta de comidas y al cuidado de niños (Wawa Wasi).  Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años, el préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio de venta de ropa.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará productos de abarrotes para implementar su tienda, utensilios para la venta de comida y un fardo de ropa americana.  Ella trabaja junto con una amiga. Su esposo trabaja en transporte como chofer.
Su sueño es tener su tienda  de abarrotes bien implementado.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Communal Bank “Flor de Canela” (Cinnamon Flower) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Puno. She is 28 years old, married, and has two children. Nancy has a technical degree.

She sells clothing and food. In addition, she takes care of children at a day care center. Nancy has worked with Manuela Ramos for four years. Her first loan of 300 PEN was used for her business of selling clothes.

With this new loan of 1000 PEN, she will buy groceries to keep her store in operation, utensils for her food business, and one bundle of American clothing. She works together with a friend. Her husband works in the transportation sector as a driver.

Nancy’s dream is to have a grocery store that is well-managed. What she enjoys most about the Communal Bank are the convenience of the loans and the savings.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, cooking utensils, and one bundle of clothes.

loans.name: Kenbe Fem 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel  est le coordinateur de son groupe kenbe fem

 Il n’est pas marié mais il a 2 enfants.

Emmanuel habite dans la ville de paulette d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Emmanuel a dirigé son business pendant les 5 dernières années.

 Avant de commencer ce commerce, Emmanuel etait a l’ecole

Emmanuel voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du carburant.

emmanuel espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.

Des autres membres de les kenbe fem ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et du poisson.

Emmanuel dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant .

Emmanuel dit que ses buts principals sont l’augmantation du bussiness. Son rêve est l’achat d’une moto pour transporter les materiels comme farine.
texts.en:
Emmanuel  is the coordinator of his group, Kenbe Fem. He is not married, but he has two children. 

Emmanuel lives in the town of Paulette in Haiti where electricity is rare and running water is very limited. He has been running his business for the last five years. Before beginning this business, he was at school.

Emmanuel would like to use this loan to invest in buying fuel. He hopes that the loan will help him to expand his business. Other members of Kenbe Fem need a loan for businesses such as selling charcoal, rice and fish.
